This must be what the government uses for torture, because it was certainly torture watching it.

Review title: An All Time Low for Comedy
Review_body: I work at a movie theater, so the only reason I went to see this movie was because it was free and I thought that it just might be the kind of movie that's so bad me and my friends could entertain ourselves by making fun of it. However, Meet the Spartans left us completely dumbfounded and speechless. It's beyond bad! There was nothing you could say that could make of this movie, it does it all by itself and it doesn't even allow you to laugh while you watch it going down in flames. I considered its predecessor, Epic Movie, to be among one of the worst movies ever made. I didn't think it could possibly get worse, but it did. It's like watching 300 all over again expect with ridiculous pop culture references that aren't even funny. The guys who made this movie obviously don't understand comedy in the slightest bit. I hope that this is the last one of these ridiculous comedies that gets to occupy a theater over another film that might actually be worth something. This film is a waste of money for starters, but even if you don't have to pay, it's just a waste of time.

Review title: if you are in the mood for some fun at the movies and don't want to sit trough a 2 hour epic movie then I urge you to see this
Review_body: When I went to see this movie I thought it would be good for some laughs, and at that it did not fail. The acting was mediocre at best,and the lead actor did look a bit like Leonidas. Carmen Elektra also stars and see is a character you just never miss seeing. Being a fan of 300 I din't know if I should've been proud that they chose it or insulted, I was happy. The gay jokes where a little bit tiresome at the end but no matter what you read from the next reviews probably whiten by people like the ones who choose the Oscars, meaning only liking movies the 70 men like who think this type of movie are stupid or childish, you never get tired of seeing Simon Cowell and Britney being kicked in the giant pit of death. All and all I'd have to say that this is a great movie that din't get the respect it deserves and one you should see.

Review title: By no means a GOOD movie, but not AS bad as I though it would be.
Review_body: I absolutely HATED epic movie and date movie. the recent disaster movie was even WORSE. Meet the spartans was definitely not a very funny movie but unlike its predecessors it had a funny moment or two. yes, most of the jokes fell flat but there were a few that managed to save this from being a total failure. still, the majority of the jokes simply left you with a kind of wtf? feeling. (like the gta reference, what was the point of that?anyway, if you can manage wading through a pile of lame jokes to pick out the couple of actually fairly funny jokes then go ahead and see this. but otherwise watch something else.

Review title: Do not watch, waste of time and money!!!
Review_body: This film is the worst film I have ever seen in my life. If you do go to see it please do not kid yourself that it will get better through the film it stays the same boring pathetic self for all the long one hour and 23 minutes that it goes on. This film is the perfect cure to insomnia. If you want to see the best this film has to offer please save yourself the time and money and just watch the adverts.The film is awful at best, the actors have tried their best (it must be said). But nothing could save this film. There are way too many things they have tried to spoof, not just films but famous people. It does get ridiculous the amount they have tried to cram in to the film. And a lot does not make any sense at all.

Review title: not even as good as some classic turkeys
Review_body: The films of Ed Wood have been used as a standard to show how bad movies can be. Their plots didn't make much sense, the acting was terrible, their lack of production values was the lowest around, but they did have a sense of dignity about them. They tried to be the best they could be and were horrible anyway.Meet the Spartans fails on so many different grounds, the real question that needed to be asked was who gave this movie a green light in the first place and why is this person still working in Hollywood? A SNL skit of about two minutes might have been the end result and we might have forgiven them for it, since at least on SNL they try new things.While I only spent $3 on my ticket, I feel like they need to pay me back for the time they took away from my movie life. I've seen offensive movies before and there is usually a point to be made, here the only point is "I've got you ticket money and what will you do about it." I am ashamed for those actors who with this on their credits may never get another acting role again in their lives, why risk something like this? I really hope that the producers/writers/ and actors for this dreck will offer an apology to the film community for this. Ed Wood is now not at the bottom of the heap when it comes to making films.

Review title: Meet the Spartans? I'd rather meet my maker, thanks.
Review_body: This is one of a few select movies I have watched in my lifetime that I have been both physically and mentally unable to reach the end. The first 30 minutes of it was enough to make me realise that had I watched the second half, I would be one day lying on my death bed wishing that I would have spent that time doing something more beneficial such as picking the fluff out of my belly button.Everything about this film is completely wrong. The only redeeming feature is that it's good to know that Sean Maguire - who made my ears bleed in the early nineties with a short lived career in pop - wasn't actually getting as successful in the states as the rumours I'd heard had stated.

Review title: I think most people took this movie way too seriously
Review_body: I am certainly in the minority but this movie just dumped all of the 90-2000s pop culture in to the death pit. People who have actually seen 300 can enjoy it to the fullest! Plus if they have enough knowledge of the references that has been brought in the mix with ancient Greece.It's 2018 and I have watched it again! It certainly stood out to be one of the best parodies of all times, IMO (besides scary movie series). P.S: Carmen Electra is drop dead hot!

I thought this movie was extremely stupid. I know its expected from a movie like this but I thought maybe I would enjoy this because I enjoyed the Scary Movies so i thought this one could possibly be enjoyable. False. Everything in this movie was overdone,a lot of the humor just grossed you out to the point where you felt uncomfortable and I only give it more than 1 star only because they did nail some celebrities and there was a few funny lines but a majority of it was just ridiculous. For example, in the commercial they show the "pit of death" when they push in Britney Spears, they did that in the movie approximately 8 times. It was getting really old, really fast. It was all in slow motion too, so the scene was much longer than it needed to be. I would not suggest that you waste money on this movie, if you want to see what its like then wait for it to come out on stars because it really is not worth $8.

Review title: Ordered a copy right after I watched it
Review_body: Gee whiz, I thought the stick up my butt was just as firmly planted as the next guy. Apparently not. Too bad this comment will fall into line after all the haters. But I had to write because it's so funny for different reasons.Before Airplane! started its string of spoofs as farces, spoofs had another form, as parody. Mel Brooks gave us Young Frankenstein and Blazing Saddles, big-budget parodies of horror and western flicks, played as if serious. Think of the synchronized swim nuns in History of the World or the crazy 40's dance number at the end of Blazing Saddles.The Meet spoof of Stomp the Yard gave me a big smile just because the excellent talent in Meet perfectly matched Yard in an absurd as Spartans vs Persians context. Spoof as parody instead of farce is not new, it may just be a unfamiliar to some of the reviewers.The 300 movie was so beautifully art directed and shot, the story a genuine epic, and the film heroic and moving. Meet the Spartans plays on this with big chunks of entertainment that I can appreciate.You won't get a production like Tvatzy singing "I'm Tired of Men" from the excellent Zucker/Abrahams/Zucker spoofs. But you'll find one even funnier if you know who Marlene Dietrich is. Not all spoof forms are what you're used to. After all, comedy was born way before we were.

Review title: Whenever it was funny it wasn't intended ....
Review_body: Whenever u thought that parodies couldn't get much lower then the last one that passed the screen, then u see another one and u just realized that the bucket is way much deeper then u can imagine. This movie, and I don't even want to go into the acting of the movie, because and let me try to say this with a example to show u at what level the actors did perform. It is like putting up apples and letting them play lemons. Truly unbelievable and awesomely bad. Story lines never that much of an issue in parodies anyway, usually they take out one movie, and slightly follow that line (in this case '300') and around that they intend to build up one joke after the other. And that is where it is all going to hell, for as far I am concerned. I really had to struggle to watch the last 60 min of the movie, and let me remind u that the movie is only 80 min or so. To see Carmen Electra showing up once again in this type of film doesn't surprise me at all, she has no more reputation left to ruin, so much lower then she is already she cannot sink. And Kevin Sorbo (Hercules) well just shows how good his acting-career is going that he is obliged to be in pictures like this. And to be honest he is the most funniest actor in the whole movie, considering he has not one single funny bone in his body. But then again it shows u once more the level of this movie. I gave it a 2 rating, but even that is over appreciated, but seeing that I am a nice guy and I can appreciate the effort and the money that was put into this project, I think they can use some small amount of support, but that is a far as my generosity goes. To end it off, I would say stay away from this, unless u are a fan of Carmen and love seeing her half naked. (But for that I would suggest you-tube, couple of thousands clips of her there also, and u don't need to sit out 75 min of crap) And if u do really want to spend money on this, better spend on a lottery-ticket, u will have more chance of winning a prize there, then seeing a good movie here.

Review title: worth seeing on a cheap night or rent it
Review_body: I thought is was really funny.It is 99% gay jokes.I guess it could be considered offensive by too serious people.I recommend it.If you expect a lot from this film, you'll be disappointed.If you have seen 300, this is worth seeing.It is worth seeing on a cheap night or renting it.Don't expect much.There is nothing requiring a big screen.I went to a cheaper matinée, I'm glad I didn't pay full price for it.

Review title: This film made me feel dirty.
Review_body: Shameful, absolutely shameful; shockingly unfunny, embarrassingly awful; I cannot put this film down far enough. The gags come thick and fast, the problem is they're simply not funny. I didn't go and see this film out of choice and fortunately for me, I didn't pay to see it. If I had, I'd have demanded a refund. This is quite possibly one of the worst films ever made and the shameful advertising of several well known products within the film made me feel sick.The "actors," and I use the term loosely, are in my opinion nothing more than mere whores as it seems to me they will do anything for money. To stoop so low as to appear in a howler like this, removes any shred of credibility they may have had (that's assuming they had any in the first place).Do yourselves a favour and stay away from this turkey. And if in the future, any more of these films are made by the same company, stay away from them too as I'll willingly wager they'll be no better.

i don't understand why all you guys are so mad with this movie? i didn't expect to see anything serious in this movie, it's all for gags and fun, and it's quite funny that it joked all those new movies and even Paris Hilton, i laughed numerous times and i enjoyed it. especially for the 007 scene, it was quite a surprise to see Leonidas got his ball hit and bite by a dog, that was really a lmao!the story plot was not creative, except from those funny crossovers, there's nothing new for the story as it simply copied 300, everything was expected, made me a bit boring though, it would be better if it creates a new story like scary movies series. if the plot wasn't so original i would give a 8.

Review title: If you have low expectations, you won't be so bummed
Review_body: Now cmon. Who actually thought this would be a good movie before they went to see it? Looking at the other films Seltzer and Friedberg have made did you actually think this one would break the mold of unfunny spoof films? I didn't, but I still like to actually see the movie BEFORE I rip on it. Now that being said, I got 100% what I expected: An occasional chuckle, but mostly lame jokes that are beaten to death, bad acting, bad direction, cheap looking sets and Carmen Electra looking more and more haggard with each passing movie. Even the product placement bits weren't that funny. These guys need to go back and watch Airplane, Naked Gun, Scary Movie 1, or even Spaceballs to see how a spoof movie should be made. The cutaway jokes on Family Guy rip pop culture far more effectively and much funnier than what this movie tries to do. Though I must admit, the idea of kicking annoying celebrities into a bottomless pit is a great idea, someone should've thrown the makers of this movie in there with them.

How can so many people miss the point of this movie. Its a parody of another movie. I think all the people criticising this film should go and watch a movie called 300 first and then watch it again. Believe me if you do this you'll soon be cursing yourself for sounding like such fools.The way it takes a serious film (300) and makes it hilarious is cutting edge. My favourite scene was the dance off, if you know anything about sparta you would know that there is no way they would ever dance, let alone take the time for choreography lessons. Not funny if you know nothing of spartan culture, bone-achingly funny if you do.Thats the tragedy of this film, if people watched 300 first, or did any historical research into spartan culture, they would see the wonderful humour brimming so tantalisingly beneath the surface. We are not laughing at what the spartans are doing, but rather laughing at things they would never do. Irony is the mother of comedy.I challenge you to watch 300, research ancient sparta and then watch this film. You won't regret it.

Review title: A few good gags. . but not quite enough
Review_body: I should preface this by saying Airplane! and I'm Gonna Get You Sucka are my two favorite movies of all time. In both cases, I can quote entire scenes and yet, somehow, they're still funny to me.This movie was no Airplane! I'm sure I could work in an easy joke about it not even being a bomb dropped by an airplane, but I digress.A few good gags here: The slow motion battle scene The skipping/marching and Hi-fives vs tongue-kiss - both based on the "there's a tone of homoerotic tension here - because they're secretly GAY! HA HA HA". If they hadn't beaten these jokes into the ground, they would have stayed funny.The FIRST time they booted someone into the pit (had they only done it once, maybe twice and then went straight to the Idol judges, it might have worked better). I watched the unrated version from the DVD and almost all of the jokes, even when midly funny, went on waaay to long, especially the dancing Stomp The Yard parody - which was a funny gag, for the first maybe 10 seconds as the idea of the Spartans and their enemies fighting through dance sequence was rather inspired.For every decently funny gag here, there were a bunch that fell flat or left me going WTF? (Transformers!?! Black Spiderman?).I can only recommend this to fans of the genre with a few hours to kill and a Netflix/digital Cable subscription - so that you don't have to pay any extra to watch this.

Review title: I absolutely loved it! Don't waste time reading my review, go rent it!!
Review_body: Im still laughing! If you like the kind of stupid humor that Will Ferrel makes, then you will love this. Its so funny, the jokes are half stupid and half smart and if you like one of the jokes, you will like all of them! Don't listen to "pollards11" review, i mean, he might not like the type of humor, but that doesn't mean that the movie is "like an hour of hell.". I try not to judge movies by my own opinion, i try to see what other people might think of this movie. Just because i loved it doesn't mean its really good and everything, I'm just saying, if you have a stupid sense of humor like me, go rent it or something because its awesome.

Review title: In the top 3 worst movies I've ever seen.
Review_body: Short and sweet. I never walk out of the cinema during a movie this is the 1st I've ever walked out on. Only thing funny is how unfunny this movie is. Your eyes will bleed after watching this. You've been warned. Everyone must watch this once and Im sure 99.9% of people will agree it to be the worst or one of the worst movies of all time.

Review title: Thats it, all those previews were just a waste
Review_body: I watched the previews for this movie and people said "So far the best comedy of the years" "4 stars" What the hell are these people thinking.This movie was stupid. I timed it, the movie was an hour and 5 mins long, not including the previews, so stupid. Terrible acting, terrible everything.Some parts were funny, but it got so boring. I can't handle this movie, I can't think about it. I think I got Spartans Disease, now I can't reproduce, I can't hear. My life is ruined. May I R.I.P.And may I say, "DON'T SEE THIS MOVIE, IT IS TOO LATE FOR ME, BUT PLEASE DON'T SEE IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!"

Review title: why why why did i watch this
Review_body: My girl friend wanted me to watch this with her and I couldn't say no and let me tell you this is just garbage .only a 5 year old would laugh at all the dumb lines. There's no plot there's no good characters or anything. Also this movie is short which is actually really good makes you suffer less from this crapfest. and why is there 1000 people that gave this movie a 10? Are you being serious this movie is one of the worst movies I have seen in a very long time. Avoid this movie at all cost don't even rent it, Hollywood needs to think twice at doing a parody, I miss the good ol movies like Airplane! even the first Scary Movie wasn't to bad so I suggest you to do instead of wasting the money on buying a movie ticket you should use that money and rent Airplane! at least you will get some laughs off at the movie 1\10 for Meet the Spartans

I'm not going to say much about this movie. It just blew. I liked the Scary Movies, that's just my taste in comedies. But the latest movies in this genre just have the lowest level of humor. This whole dancing thing and the gay thing were just so cheesy and annoying that I almost couldn't sit trough the whole movie. But I did, and I still reject the day that I did that... I also hated that they did BAD impressions of the famous people of America, favorite games, TV shows that are watched by a lot of people and other movies or characters of that movie. And then the thing with the pit of death! I guess they thought their movie was too short so they stretched out a joke so far that it is not funny anymore. And the sexuality of Carmen Electra was way over the top. I gave it a 2, not a 1, because I thought there are movies worse then this one. I haven't found them yet, but I know that they're out there. Don't get me wrong and I said it before: I like parodies and I like the kind of humor Leslie Nielsen, kind of, introduced. But this was nothing like it. They tried, but didn't succeed. If your curious about this movie, watch it. But if you're not, don't do this to yourself. It's just not worth it. Life's too short.

My friends said, "It's awful! Please don't see it!" I should have listened to them.This movie left me speechless. I went in thinking my wise old friends were just too critical, and I came out horrified. I was expecting just some lame, stupid spoof that actually had a funny joke here and there, but all it was was just all of the vulnerable celebrities out there being teased and then pushed into a pit.The commercials were also very misleading. They made the movie actually look half decent. But the sad yet honest truth is that the slams and teasing they call "jokes" about the movies and celebrities were really crude, impolite, and way too overboard.As funny as the commercials make it look, this movie is very mean, gross, and juvenile. So, just like my dear friends warned me, DON'T SEE IT.

When some people look back on their life, their greatest regret will be not spending more time with their children, or not telling that special someone their feelings, or not trying harder in high school and getting a comfortable job. Mine however will be handing over £5.50 of my money to the incompetent duo who made this film and sitting through the 70 most deeply boring/embarrassing minutes of my life in a cinema when I could be doing something more fun. What? Almost anything.This film has no redeeming features. From the soundtrack, which consists solely of cheap hip-hop and inept remixes of dance songs, to the effects, most of which wouldn't look out of place in an amateur Be Kind Rewindesque fan parody (if you want to parody Transformers, then at LEAST make your vehicles, you know, TRANSFORM), to the acting (clearly they think they can get away with the shoddiest, hammiest high-school play acting, so long as they punctuate it with fanservicey images of Carmen Elektra), is so poorly executed you wonder whether the makers of this film are deliberately doing everything they were told not in film school.Special mention of course goes to the humour. Whether it's a "hilarious" bodily fluid splatter joke, a very 'political' jab against some Hollywood celebrity (oh, Britney shaving her head! Clever), "postmodern" product-placement (ie, adverts so blatant you just stare on aghast) or a reference to some obscure minutiae of American popular culture (half the reality shows references will be forgotten within a year), there's not an intentional laugh in the film. The only points that even raised a chuckle were: a) the terrible lookalikes (apparently, the only criteria for being a Paris Hilton lookalike is that you are blond), b) the shoddy effects, c) the nonsensical casting of "the fat guy from Borat" as Xerxes and the moronic narrator telling us "Xerxes looked like the fat guy from Borat". See, the thing is, he really didn't.My only wish is that cinemas gave out refunds. If they did, this film would most definitely be worth your money back.

Review title: As Bad as Bad Can Get!
Review_body: One of the tricks to making a truly funny movie is that it has a real story line that is not a joke or gag but selectively inserts the jokes and gags when they are most appropriate. Alas, the makers of this steaming turd did not know the difference. Yes, 300 is a perfect movie to parody and with the budget and production values this movie has (very good) they could have made a great flick. Unfortunately, they seem to think that every single portion of the film should be some sort of gag. There are about 3 funny bits in this film. They are mixed with about 300 very unfunny bits. Pop culture parodies that don't work combined with sight gags that are predictable. I really cannot say enough bad things about this film. The makers of it should be barred from ever making another movie. It's not even the kind of bad that can be funny in it's own unintentional way, like a Steven Segal movie. Do not see this movie under any circumstances!

This movie, next to Wolf Creek, is the worst movie I've ever seen. This was supposed to be a comedy? I laughed I think one time. They definitely needed to not put this movie in theaters, but the funny thing is that this movie is #1 at the box office. Half of the stuff I seen in the previews wasn't even in the movie. There is nothing positive I can say about this movie. The only spoof movies worth talking about are the Scary Movies. Carmen Electra is absolute garbage, she needs to stop trying to be funny, it almost hurts me when she tries. All and all this movie was just flat terrible, I will never recommend this movie to anyone. * out of 10.

Review title: The only thing worse than a Chevy Chase movie...
Review_body: I was expecting at least Naked Gun laughs out of this movie, I guess I raised the bar too "high". My god, is this movie horrible.The worst thing is all the pop-culture jokes, I mean spoofing reality shows and t.v. commercials is not that funny. At least with Scary Movie or the like you get something that can make you laugh at least once. This movie is just lame.Some of the incredibly unfunny scenes just go on forever. That really takes the wind out of already lame jokes.If someone drags you to this film, take a pillow with you... at least then you won't waste your time.

All right Jason and Aaron you just make me Sick. All you do is just to add more pop culture jokes and it full of crap. Do you know how to make an actual jokes for once?. STOP MAKING THEM Because that Formula of your "humor" and the movies you make is not appreciated. Thinks about it, you are actually make fun of them. Even in the theaters, i saw some of them left after 15 minutes of the movie, overheard saying they couldn't take it anymore.Every moment in the movie was like the same jokes all over again and again. There is this one embarrassed moment where Carmen covered her nipples and covered her crotch. That is the type that under 13 should not see. Jason and Aaron you know more English and have better compromise? I think of two things that are bad: all you do is intimate blockbuster characters and find it for everyone an insult. Pop cultures references are too off the wall and make fun of them. People, Don't waste your money on this crap. So freaking horrible. Just a luck to waste a money where movie is really bad.

Review title: Awful in parts, but really a leg up over Friedburg and Seltzers other films
Review_body: Don't get me wrong, I am not a fan of Jason Friedburg or Aaron Seltzer, in fact I go out of my way to avoid their films. I was only marginally entertained by "Scary Movie"(I'm sure most of which all had to do with the Wayans brothers), and abhorred the sequel. I saw "Scary Movie 4"(but not the third movie) just to pass the time with a friend, and despite maybe one joke that worked(Sort of. It's the one where a ray gun disintegrates everyones clothes), I was utterly bored. "Date Movie" was another film I saw almost out of some obligation to watch whatever DVD my pop collects, and the film was horrible and monotonous, and worst of all, boring. There is nothing worse than a bad comedy. I didn't follow up on "Epic Movie", "Superhero Movie", "Disaster Movie", and I will probably never watch anything else by these hacks again.In between all this garbage however, is "Meet the Spartans", which isn't as shallow or tedious as their other films. Actually, some of the jokes work, and that is because this film has the good sense to wield sex as its arbitrator of humor. Not all, mind you, but a surprising amount of the humor works, which is a lot of gay jokes, as Greeks are famous for their comfort with homosexuality inmany instances. There are also jokes intended for the red blooded male in mind. I was surprised at how the actors actually put conviction into these jokes, as if they actually are trying to entertain the audience. If it is on a base level, at least it is a pleasurable one.Also, there are a few dance numbers in here which entertained me, and the reason I liked them is because they were silly, out of left field, and not as mean spirited as Friedburg/Seltzer skits usually are. Also, I think that they inadvertently raised the level of craftsmanship by placing the story in a historical context. Even if you know nothing about the Greeks outside of "300", at least that makes you aware that there is life outside of vapid popular culture. Oh sure, there are plenty of cringe worthy references to celebrities and American Idol, but than again, what were you expecting from this movie?

Review title: Meet The Spartans; Why IMDb Needs a NO STARS Rating Option
Review_body: I'd seen Meet The Spartans on the shelves of the local rental store and got it when I was running out of choices and desperate enough to rent anything. Hmmm... no quotes from critics. That's ALWAYS a bad sign. Was it straight to video? But it started out with the 20th Century Fox intro so it couldn't be that bad... right? Perhaps I'm not qualified to give a review let alone rate this film since I thought it was idiotic by minute 1 and getting worst by the second. By minute 3 I'd already thought I'd wasted enough of my precious life and turned it off to get back to the HBO mini-series on John Adams. Now THAT is something worth seeing. It is for movies like this that IMDb does its readers a disservice by not allowing a NO Stars vote. The default 1 Star = awful ends up being too generous for trash like such as this. So this film actually made it to the theaters?

This movie is so bad I'm actually seething with anger.Now I knew very well this movie was considered one of the worst movies ever made before I decided to watch it (online by the way, no way I'd pay for this crap). So I was prepared. Or so I thought. Nothing could prepare me for 65 minutes of pure hell. I laughed more watching "Schindler's List".How this movie was ever made is beyond me. Add to that the fact that it was number one at the box office and made $17 million....well I'm not sure what to say to that. For some reason I think of all the good that could have been done with $17 million. How about helping the millions of people who live in poverty around the world? Instead two morons that disguise themselves as directors and writers and some heartless studio execs pocket most of the money. I sincerely hope the two so-called directors never work again. At any job. I don't even want to be served at a McDonalds Drive Thru by these guys.I'm not going to comment on any part of the movie. It just doesn't deserve it. I can honestly say I didn't even crack a smile while watching this train wreck of a movie.So please, please heed my advice. DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE. EVER.Even if it's on TV in a few years and there is nothing else on, don't watch it. If you have a choice between watching it and getting a red hot poker shover up your behind, take the poker. Burns will heal but this movie will stick with you forever.Now please excuse my while I try to intentionally give myself some light brain damage in the hope that I can forget ever watching "Meet the Spartans".

I can not recommend this film enough. There is not a single thing about it with which I can find fault. It surpasses everything that I have ever used for subduing primates that have been severely agitated after gene-splicing therapy. Ketamine, opium, ether and good old-fashioned chloroform do not even come close - not only because of dosage considerations, but also because you have to buy them more than once. This film, however, works every time with no loss of effect: the primates seem to be unable to build any resistance whatsoever. Every single time I put it on the projectors they are slumped against the bars of their cages, drooling, within 40 minutes. An outstanding product.

Review title: There's a reason why I broke the DVD I borrowed back in 2010.
Review_body:
And that was from a video store! I know that such places should never have existed considering the prevalence of piracy when this was released, but there were. So, just to maximize what I could use on my viewership points, I took this one out of the shelf. I did not like it then, so I broke it and just told the store guy that my kid accidentally sat on it. I paid a not-so-hefty-fine, so that should be okay.
Fast forward to today (2020). I have been doing a DVD exchange with my friend to pass the time during this pandemic, and this was one of the things he sent me. This one won't be part of the return package. if it turns out be one of his guilty pleasures, i'd gladly pay back.

Review title: Just wastage of time and money.
Review_body: Don't watch this movie. There's nothing in it but if you want to spend few hours,it doesn't matter what you are watching then this movie will work surely.

Review title: Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer are hacks
Review_body: Anyone who would remotely consider themselves to be a fan of the spoof genre would reject this trash. I'll be the first one to admit that taste is subjective, but the guys that made this movie lack any sort of talent for this type of movieI implore anyone to check out the following spoof movies: Airplane! Top Secret The Naked Gun The Naked Gun 2 1/2 Hot Shots Hot Shots: Part Deux Kentucky Fried Movie (yes, its "old" but a classic none the less) Mafia! BASEketball Scary Movie 3 Sacry Movie 4 Not all of these are great. Many are a product of their era. Some are downright "average" spoof movies, at best. But compared to "Meet the Spartans" (or Epic Movie or Date Movie) they are a BILLION times better. And they have one thing in common... Zucker / Abrahams / Zucker (also must give props to writer Pat Proft). These guys INVENTED this genre. Watch these films and you will realize Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer are talentless hacks who think just making a reference to pop culture is funny. If Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer are reading this, I suggest you might want to watch these movies as well. You might learn a thing or two.

Review title: The Greatest Stupidity Of All Times
Review_body: Well, I rate this film with 2 because of it's maximum dullness that any film before this one never had. In this movie you can see parody toward the ''Shrek'', ''Borat'', ''Texas Chainsaw Massacre'', and of course, toward the movie ''300''. Carmen Electra acting is similar to those amateur actresses of porn movies, and acting of the rest of the cast is drowned in homosexuality and totally lack of mimic and quality. Humour in this movie is equal to the smile of the mule. Except the good thing that this piece of s''t lasts about 65min. everything other is horrible and boring to death. There's no one guff in this movie that is funny, except King Leonidas repeating replica toward the Persian: ''Their wast numbers will count as s**t''. If you're a fan of the ''300'', please don't watch this crap, better spend your time and money on something constructional and useful, like dating a girlfriend or take the dog for a walk, it's spring!

Look this movie is not a masterpiece but I have to tell ya there were at LEAST 17 VERY funny moments. Is it art? No Is it highbrow? NoAre there moment of hilarity? Absolutely yes. The movie should be seen!!! The first 15 mins. are hysterical.End of review the rest is just filler......Please remember that the guidelines state that if you write a spoiler without warning readers, your name will be added to a blacklist and all your future reviews will be discarded automatically and unread. So please be careful and use the 'contains spoiler' check box if your comment contains spoilers.

Review title: Not that bad, for a 'focused' parody
Review_body: I don't know why so many people give this movie a bad rep. I mean, what did you expect? It's a parody, featuring Carmen Electra. Duhh! And it's only focused on a single movie, '300', so it doesn't have that much stuff to choose from and make fun of. Maybe they expected Kevin Sorbo to play Hercules again, saving the Spartans from certain doom! ;) Of course, that's not the case.If you watched '300' recently, and u still remember the original scenes, and if u enjoy parodies like "Scary Movie", "Not Another Teen Movie" etc., feel free to watch this one as well.As i said, it's not that bad.

Review title: I was sorry I saw this one...
Review_body: There were barely a few good jokes in this cinema-degraded-flop-of-a-movie. It was just awful all around. I was hoping that it was more than the trailers. The trailers were the best parts. Nothing like taking a few jokes and trying to stretch it into a full-length movie. The spoofs were disinteresting and not as funny as I hoped. The raw and raunchy parts would only appeal to the most trashiest senses of humor. For the homo-phobics this is not the movie for you. I hoped that the trailers would have shown more of the movie so that people could really make up their minds before they go to the theater. All the other spoof-type movies are so much better, this is truly the bottom of the barrel. Sorry I wish I could say something better for this one, but I can't. I just can't.

Review title: Absolute garbage; almost true to its original intent.
Review_body: To begin, let's get something straight: this movie was atrocious. However, when calling it such, you must remember that this is the entire intent of the film, as well as most other true spoof films. Did this one have the potential to be better? Certainly.Clocking in at just under an hour and a half, shorter if you exclude credits, Meet the Spartans is dry, oft-boring, and random to an extent that makes it difficult to tell when they're actually trying to tell a joke. Though well-conceived, the painfully short running time coupled with what was obviously a microscopic budget meant that this film came across as being far too much funny crammed into too small a space. The result? A new joke was on the screen before the previous one had yet to develop into a punch line, and the audience is left with nothing but a bunch of half-finished humor.Now, about that 4 / 10 rating I delivered this dreadful film; don't get me wrong, the movie is garbage. However, there was the occasional moment in which an imaginative mind was able to have a slight deal of fun with the material presented, including one such humorous take on the excessive use of green/blue-screening in almost all modern films (that, and I reserve lower ratings for far worse films). The only real reason this had any laughable effect was because it was a joke re-used at what could almost be called the right times. Every other portion of humor present in the film was long gone nearly three seconds after it was generated and had absolutely no relevant bearing to the remainder of the film. It was much akin to telling of a murder mystery by introducing over eighty characters in the first half and then having them all leave while one man comes into the center of the frame and commits the crime in front of everyone. No joke was ever given time to develop, and no characters were given even the slightest amount of depth. Now, I know that's asking a lot from a modern comedy, but in all seriousness, I've had gas that had more character.In all honesty though, it was still worth a laugh here and there.This film will be particularly enjoyed by goldfish, who have a short enough attention span to enjoy all the jokes in sequence.

Review title: America! I plead with you to stop!!!
Review_body: Please please help me America. You helped this movie gross masses at the US Box office which means again the Men behind most of Americas horrendous comedies of recent years are going to keep churning them out. To add insult to injury you also cast one of Britain's golden boys in the title role and probably ruined his career in the process.This movie is the worst movie of all time. OK I smiled all the way through but only because I cannot believe the studios funded this utter rubbish. Beware, I feel "Scary Movie 15" or "American Pie 61" being made off the profits they took from this. If you enjoyed this movie you are either in a padded cell or know the crew. Please don't send anything this bad to our shores again!

Review title: Meet the Spartans -better than the material it's spoofing-most of the time.
Review_body: Meet the Spartans may be silly and stupid but it is a spoof after all. I laughed out loud repeatedly when I saw it last week On Demand. OK-it was free and the price was right. It's a spoof of the movie 300. saying it had no plot is nonsense. It actually follows the movie from beginning to end. I've watched 300 3 x now and MTS 3+ x. On the whole,MTS was the better movie. I could have done without the defecating penguin and the general use of body fluids for laughs from the first shot of the the baby Leonides(who did look a lot like a baby Shrek) to the Pit of Doom to Xerxes (who's body jewelry I thought was over the top-till I saw 300!)and the training of the small boys( which again struck me as too harsh-till I saw 300.) All in all,this reminded me of SNL spoofing S. Palin. The lines were already there. So was the plot. If you didn't like the spoof,maybe you should take a more critical look at the original.So here I am -it's July 18,2009. I have watched the movie 5 times-at least. As soon as I get around to it ,I will buy a copy.It's fandamdtastic. I read ALL the comments. SHAME one your closed little minds. I don't usually waste much time on spoofs but this was a worthy one. I watched it in isolation. I watched after having seen its model. Best of all,I watched the 2 movies back to back. Wow! The 300 was pretentious crap. Really. But Meet The Spartans made it forever,memorable pretentious crap.I especially love the spray-on six packs and the dancing and skipping.But then I have a superb sense of humour and just love the snark. As for the child abuse? It's actually a pretty broad depiction of what happens in 300. So maybe you should watch closer.

The tools who wrote and produced this movie need to stop turning everything into a dance battle. It's not funny.The great spoof movies contain lots of great one-liners and little 3 second references to their serious counterparts etc. They do not take a bunch of Pop Culture references and make 15 minute scenes out of each of those references.These guys need a kick in the head.

Review title: One of the worst movies I have ever watched.
Review_body: I think the purpose of this movie was for advertisement, specially American idol. Everything looked so fake and the acting was terrible. I don't see what is funny of many of these "jokes". The main bad guy transformed to literally fall a minute after, is that supposed to be funny?Besides advertisement, it seems the purpose of the movie was to insult several celebrities and their life decisions or how they represent themselves. That may be funny, but again it was done in such disorganized manner that it was confusing of why they were introduced in the movie. Literally, anyone could have directed this movie. It was a collection of "funny" scenes in random order.

check out Meet the Spartans. When I watched 300 it bothered me because it took itself so seriously and it didn't have much of a story. This doesn't have much of a story either and yes it is a rip off of 300 but it is aware that it is stupid and it is a fun diversion. I'm sure if I was a fan of 300 I would think this movie sucked but since it isn't the case, I have to say I enjoyed the movie with all its stupid humor, advertising within the film, and all the pop culture references. This movie will definitely be very dated later on but for right now its funny. However if you haven't seen 300 and don't watch much TV its really not going to be much fun at all. Most of the humor assumes that you have seen these popular shows like American Idol, Deal or No Deal, & etc. My friend hadn't seen 300 so they didn't appreciate much of the humor. Make sure you at least see 300 first and if you didn't like it you may enjoy this.

Review title: I don't really know what im going to type...
Review_body: ... but i started a new job last week. A really cool one, thought! It computer related and there are like a thousand NERDS.... one of them told me to get it from the shared disc and i did.... You know... the movie doesn't met to be good anyways-.... but my lil' almost 8 years old brother (is called Alejo) loved it... what can i say? Im 25 and yesterday i saw Cloverfield and i hate it... i think that probably this is a funnier movie... right?Owh.... and i love Carmen Electra.She's 37 dude.... and still hot and shht! (not that many plastic... i can tell)Njoy

This film is perfect for someone who wants to go to the movies and relax and have a good time without having to think too much or waste much emotional energy in a film, it's just a short film that is easy to take in unless you're so uptight that you actually squirm from this movie because you can't stand a spoof movie that is "idiotic". (It's meant to be idiotic so just shut up)Cmon lighten up, it was a decent film with a few slight laughs and it did exactly what it was supposed to. Don't bash this film simply for existing, let it exist along with all your other "high class" films and ignore it, the fact that you're wasting time on here bashing it shows that it must have some importance to you. 7/10, it did what it was meant to and made a ton of money. major props.

Review title: Yeah, it sucked, but it made ma laugh at times...
Review_body: The only reason I rented this movie was that I wanted to see Nicole Parker and Crista Flanagan, so I gave it a shot, though I had already read some of the reviews... Well, yeah, in general, the movie sucked. Boring plot, stupid effects, and ridiculously short. But I have to give it credit because, even though it wasn't a pretty good movie, I laughed some times. I loved for example, Nicole Parker's impressions, she was brilliant doing Britney, Paris and Paula Abdul, she cracked me up. Plus the part where Leonidas is lifting Carmen Electra's character and then throws her to the floor I laughed at that part... I'm glad I only paid $0.40 to rent it, but I definitely wouldn't rent it again.Overall, sad to say, but avoid this movie. It might have had a good potential, but it was terrible.

Christ almighty. Meet the Spartans lowers the bar. Below anything we've seen before, below Epic Movie, below Date Movie, below Scary Movie 4. Unfunny, childish, crude CRAP! All the jokes, are the kind of things you giggle at when your 12...There's no redeeming factor for this film. Every spoof, every joke is not funny.Please people, save your money, time, life. DON'T GO TO SEE THIS!! There is no force on heaven, hell or earth that could make me watch MTS again. I would rather watch White Chicks on a continuous loop with my eyes held open by tweezers for a week than watch the trailer ever again.As i just began to believe cinema was getting back on tracks with NCFOM and TWBB, they release the worst film of the last 20years perhaps always...I can't believe this is top of the charts and Cloverfield, a film that has brought something new and refreshing to an overcrowded genre is mulling around the 6's or 7's.DO NOT WATCH MEET THE SPARTANS, go see Juno, anything instead!!

This review does not contain spoilers because after just three minutes into the movie I already gave up. The standard was so extremely low that I could not even bear to continue watching. I am sorry I lost just the three minutes of my life! That should be all you need to know about the movie but since I need 10 lines of text for the review I will continue to tell you to NOT DO THIS TO YOURSELF. Extremely flat jokes.Visually not tasteful. I hated everything I saw in this three minutes.Go to the dentist and have a root treatment for more fun. DO NOT WATCH THE MOVIE AND STAY AWAY!

Review title: Anyone who gave this movie a 2 out of 10 or higher needs to be put in a mental institution.
Review_body: When my friend told me that he could "hook me up" with some free movie tickets I actually got exited... Boy I wish I knew what was coming. I think that you need to be on some SERIOUS drugs to even sit through the first ten minutes. This movie is beyond bad or awful and it is officially the worst movie I have EVER seen. It seems as though all the budget for the movie was spent to make the trailers. Many people got lured to see this crap only to find out that they had been mentally raped. However what's done is done- the movie is bad and you MUST NOT see it under ANY CIRCUMSTANCES. That's why when I came home after watching this crap I first looked at who made this movie so I would preserve my brain from being raped for the future. And I was not surprised when I saw that Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are the ones responsible. Those two are world class specialists in making #### movies. They are responsible for things like "The Epic movie" as well as the "Date movie" (both are horrid). As of now I can come up with about a thousand things I want to do to Friedberg and Seltzer if I ever get a chance to meet them. None of those things are legal... Point is though - if you see Friedberg or Seltzer ANYWHERE - I really suggest you stay away from it.0 out of 10.

All I have to say is about 20 mins into the movie I was ready to leave. There was a lot of men on men action that was done to death. It was a snorefest. People actually walked out on the movie. For a spoof movie I was very disappointed. It is really hard to do bad on a spoof movie, but they did. Also, there was a lot of advertising, I left like I was watching t.v. at one point. I really do not understand how a movie like this made number one the 1st week, but I can tell you after the word gets out it will not last. This was a made for DVD movie and it did not belong in the theater.The only reason I gave it a 2 is because Hercules was in it and the girl that played Paula did a great job. That is it.

Wow. This is depressing. The creators of Not Another Teen Movie and Scary Movie are really running out of ideas.At the very beginning, where you saw Shrek, I knew the movie was going to be bad. And, sad to say, I was proved correct. The movie was like the stock market: a steady downhill.Look, all in all: I saw it because I was able to get in for free, and I was bored. If you have to pay, don't. See something else. Maybe Plan 9 From Outer Space. That was better than this piece o' crap.Please, heed my warning. If enough people see the movie, the creators will see more like it. We don;t want that.

Review title: The Worst of all Spoof Movies!!!
Review_body: I went to this movie expecting it to be fairly stupid, but I had no idea it would be this bad. I thought it was written by the guys who wrote Scary Movie because those movies are at least worth seeing. Yet, then I found out that it was written by the two guys who wrote Date Movie. I previously thought that it was not possible to make a spoof movie worse than Date Movie but I was proved wrong. Those two should be banned from making movies! The first ten minutes were actually pretty funny so i guess it wasn't all bad but after those ten minutes it was absolutely awful! I remember when spoof movies actually tied all the movies that they were making fun of together in a smart way. They just took movies and threw them in as stupidly as they possible could. It brings shame to the movie 300. It was the only movie that I've ever seen in theaters when I seriously thought about leaving. This movie was probably written in a day. If you have more than an I.Q. of .1 then do not see this film! If I could physically kill this movie I would. I think i got my point across.

Review title: The movie you'll watch when you dine in hell.
Review_body: This is perhaps one of the most awful films I've seen. Much as I enjoy tacky spoof humor, this movie just falls flat. So many of the film's jokes are so drawn out that whatever humor originally present just gets diluted. It was funny kicking a celebrity into the pit of death once. Five times later, it's just stale and dragging. If you've seen the trailers to this, you've basically seen about 90% of the film. The script could have been easily condensed to a 10 minute sketch for Saturday Night Live. The humor is so repetitive; almost all of the jokes play off either the Spartans questionable sexuality or celebrities' promiscuity. A blurred-out vagina just isn't that funny, why did the movie choose to use it 5 times? While there were numerous pop-culture references, there simply wasn't much done with it. Someone forgot to tell the middle-schooler who wrote this that having a poorly impersonated celebrity appear isn't funny by itself.Don't see this movie, even if you liked similar spoof movies (like Scary Movie).

Review title: IS this really our societies best? I want a refund on my time spent
Review_body: I registered specifically for this movie. I feel that all of us who spent not only money but TIME should file a class action lawsuit against these no-talent directors. How can you lower the standards this far and still be allowed to be on the "Silver Screen". I've seen second rate for VHS only movies better than this piece of work.I'm sad to say that this is only conforming to what our youth like. Sex and worthless humor to a youth with no low morals. Can't believe these people are catering to that fact and making money off it. Stress to your youth how trash also comes on film. This was a complete waste of time and came nothing close to what a fine Mel Brooks Spoof such as "Robinhood: Men in tights" or "Spaceballs". At least they are smart enough not to LABEL the scenes to show where the spoof comes from. A well made one wouldn't need it.

Good day to all, this here is the first comment I am ever writing on IMDb. Hopefully this isn't all that bad of a review. Well, I went to a local theater one Saturday morning to watch "Meet the Spartans". Frankly I should have jumped off the top row of seats and ended up in hospital, than watch this filth. This movie is absolutely terrible, I mean it is just another parody movie, again. HOW MANY PARODIES CAN THERE BE? I mean something called "Disaster Movie" is coming out soon, and oh dear, I can tell its going to be a stinker. But "Meet The Spartans" has terrible jokes, terrible acting, and terrible use of editing and shots and stuff, in other words its like, oh you over there! Go stand there and say some stuff that doesn't make sense! Man its bad. 300 was a good movie, but when its parodied in a way like this, it gives 300 a bad name to have this hybrid parody film on its shoulders. And well thats it, I guess... just don't go see this, after all this movie, isn't Sparta.

WARNING:Watching this film may cause an unpleasant sensation in the eyes and ears, prolonged exposure may lead to death via suicide. It is suggested that those considering viewing this film consider a more productive and enjoyable use of their time. Covering your own genitalia in dog food and attempting to outrun a Rottweiler is just one of the exciting activities you may wish to consider instead of watching this film.There is a part of this film that has merit, it is called the Credits. The Credits are a useful tool as they reveal those responsible for this abomination and enable you to avoid any of their future work.

Usually I laugh quite easily at spoof movies. I was disappointed with Epic Movie, but compared to this, it was a masterpiece. This movie did everything wrong. The pit of death scene took way to long, and right when you thought it was over they do a stupid American Idol thing where they judge Leonitis's kick. Don't waste your time with this movie. There's nothing funny in the movie that was funny. Don't even consider this movie. The Dance scene was pretty cool, but it wasn't funny, and it took to long. The movie barely passed by an hour and they had a dumb American Idol thing during the credits (I'm not sure if that's a spoiler, but I'll check it off any way). If you want a funny spoof movie then check out Superhero movie, the Scary Movie series, and for some people, Epic Movie.

Review title: I forgot how terrible this movie was...
Review_body: When this movie first came out in theaters, I went to go see it with a friend of mine, who was terminally ill. He wanted to go see it on a day that he was feeling well enough to go out, as he was a huge fan of the parody genre. At the end of the mercifully just-over-an-hour film, he turned to me and apologized for making me sit through that with him, then told me that the movie must have shortened the time he had left.In the next two years that followed, I had pretty much forgotten all about Meet the Spartans and its litany of terrible jokes and stupid sight gags. My friend passed away. I started to go to university. I got a job. And many, many better movies came out. Then, two weeks ago, the unthinkable happened. This abomination of a motion picture was unceremoniously tossed back into my life in the form of a DVD. My roommate had found it in the bargain bin at Wal-Mart and wished to watch it. I hesitantly agreed, hoping that maybe on the second viewing it would be better. Unsurprisingly, it wasn't. The jokes were still unfunny, gross-out humor that would only amuse middle school boys was still abundant, and the theme of "hurr durr, look at the ghey guyz" was still the main takeaway from this film.I had the misfortune of sitting through this atrocity twice. Save yourself the pain and misery and don't even see it once.

All of us have already watched movies that excess the human stupidity. Some of such movies include Dumb and Dumber, Ace Ventura movies, American Pie movies ... These movies definitely include scenes that are very humorous and also include jokes that have not been used before and are not too excessive. However, Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer get the award for crossing the line. They started out great with Scary Movie, but from there it seems like it just went down.I've seen Disaster Movie, and surprisingly I liked it more than I liked this movie. Don't get me wrong, Disaster Movie still is a disaster. Meet the Spartans probably just seemed worse to me, because I have seen pretty much the same jokes that are used in Disaster Movie. Everything is filmed in a same way, the same jokes are used. Not to mention the bad special effects and all the scenes that we get to see.To explain my vote of three stars - all of the jokes were not that bad and some can be quite a good laugh if you are in the mood for watching such a movie. I'm the type of person that likes things to be excessively stupid, but as I've mentioned before, the line is crossed in quite many of these films.I still intend to see Epic Movie or Date Movie, though. I just want to make sure that all of these movies are equally bad and if they really use the same type of jokes all the time. If that turns out to be true, Aaron and Jason have to think about what they are doing before releasing any more movies.

Let's go back to the facts. the movie had lots of comedy attempts. Then there's the references.There were a lot of spoofs of movie scenesThey made fun of BritneyThey also made fun of many peopleLet's see, there was also lots of false references of many things, such as sexual content.Oh, and also, should we not forget the very sexual themes. They purposely cover the women's privates, which is disgusting. If that's not enough, I guess "Leave Britney Alone" says the rest.

Review title: I've never laughed less during a comedy
Review_body: I usually think IMDB is needlessly harsh on comedies. In this case, it was warranted. If it were up to me, I would have turned it off within 5-10 minutes, but since I was watching with family, I had to stand the full 1½ hours of it. Unforgivably atrocious. A few giggles, that's it.If you really like cheap 2000s pop culture inserts into a movie set in ancient Greece, this is for you. There are ways to make parodies without being this cringe-inducing.Also, Ken Davitian's body should never be viewed in daylight. Or anywhere.

I'm a Persian/Iranian and I think the movie 300 was extremely racist. I'm not a historian and I'm not sure if the story behind the movie was true or not but the way it presented ancient Persia and Persians was offensive and not true. I think this movie is so hilarious and funny. I recommend this to every Iranian who was upset about the actual movie just like me. To know that not all Americans think about other countries like that. Personally this is not the type of cinema that I'm interested; but if one of the purposes of cinema is to tell people not to take life so serious, this movie done its job well.

Review title: Uhmm... why did I even watch this?
Review_body: Yup... that's right, my cousin treated me to watch this craptastic film. This came out in the Philippines, rather late as compared to other countries, so I just saw it two days ago. If it wasn't for the fact that my cousin paid for my ticket I would have walked out the cinema. Out of my respect for her, I decided to finish it although it felt like torture. I didn't really like it. It's not remotely funny and the jokes are downright disgusting and awful.I know some people may like spoof movies but this is not just my cup of tea.

Is there a FANS OF SPOOFS club out there who think they determine which are the good and bad ones?I am a fan of the spoof genre and I thought "Meet the Spartans" was, for the most part, funny and certainly not "trash".Some of the gags were funnier than others but most of the spoofs I've seen have that common characteristic. A spoof about the Spartans could not avoid playing off of the whole same sex relationship "thing" associated with the Spartans and with Greek society overall. Maquire is funny as is Sorbo. I've always enjoyed the way Bader plays his characters. van Winkle is a big cutie and he was funny. Parker was hilarious.

This movie is terrible, no doubt about it.I watched this movie with some friends, and even though we usually laugh of the most immature things when we hang out, we thought most of this movie sucked a lot. I have never liked spoof movies, but they can be fairly funny when you are together with the guys and being plain stupid. This however, is worse than the others I have seen (except date-movie), mostly because they have a tendency to overdo most of the jokes.Then why did I give it three stars instead of one? You would think a 18 years old boy (me) was more mature, but I thought the gay-jokes were funny. When Leonidas marches to war with his warriors to Gloria Gaynors 'I Will Survive' I actually laughed wholeheartedly. I also liked the part when Leonidas was flirting with his general's son.It doesn't save the movie, not by a long shot, and I wouldn't recommend this movie to anybody. But hey, compared to date-movie I did laugh during the film, so I couldn't give it only one star :)

Im not trying to say that this movie is better than all the funny movies that came out in the past but it was certainly not a waste of time for me. The jokes were pretty funny, especially the guys getting kicked into the pit of death and some other parts that made me laugh my ass off. Id give this movie a decent 6 out of 10 but what I don't get is the million comments about this movie being totally crappy and a wasteof time. I mean cmon people, didn't this movie make u giggle at least?This was way better compared to the first epic movie that came out and I admit it that the first one was really crappy but Meet the Spartanshad some humour in it at least so for all u haters out there,calm down!.

Very funny movie, it makes you wonder how many racists there really are when seeing so many people hated this movie because it made fun of their 300. Most of Greek or Hellenistic culture is about slavery, homosexuality, fascism, racism and hate for all other cultures. The thing i found most funny is that i seen very angry Greeks around the Internet cursing Americans for making this movie, calling them all kinds of things. Wonder how American Greek lovers like makers of 300 feel about that. Anyone who actually possess a working brain will laugh a lot seeing this movie.

This parody of 300 isn't worth paying to see. Even if it was free, I wouldn't recommend watching it.I was glad that the movie was barely 90 minutes long as I couldn't stand to watch it for much longer. I would have walked out of the movie had it not been for my friend watching it with me.The movie itself is full scenes loosely strung together, unfunny dialog, and editing that makes me wonder if Windows Movie Maker was used. Just from the opening scene there was a vomit joke (with magic vomit that disappeared the second the angle changed) and lip syncing that made a Brittany Spears concert look impressive.Also included in the movie was Carmen Electra, the walking eye candy for their 13 year old boy target demographic. Most of the scenes she was in involved the camera focusing on her breasts or her walking around in revealing clothing.After going to battle there was little direction to the movie, and they seemed to just wander around trying to make as many references to pop culture with as little humor as possible.The remainder of the "jokes" involved either product placement or homosexuality. The product placement became so frequent throughout the movie that I began to wonder if they were even making fun of it anymore.Most of these attempts at comedy were poorly received by the audience, save a few children who also had to scream out "eww" whenever the Spartans stood in a provocative position in their revealing clothing.The movie ended quite abruptly, with all Leonidas and his Spartans killed and the blind incompetent spartan inadvertently running away. It ended with the cast singing "I Will Survive" (for the second time) on an American Idol stage, and finally ending the torment of watching the movie.Overall, I would not recommend anyone viewing this movie. The whole thing looked like it was quickly filmed and edited the month before it was released and contained barely any humor.

I saw this the other day with a group of friends and I'm not sure I even saw all of it, but what I saw was enough for me to wish my $7.50 and the hour back. Seriously the version I saw was only and hour. I'm not sure if the theater missed a reel or what but I find it odd that even though I hated this film, I feel cheated by the fact that the supposed 84 min film came in at about 60 when I watched. I'll admit I chuckled every so ofter, but for the most part the fact that all the things being spoofed were telegraphed (Who are you monster! Paris Hilton! Like Toby Macquire in Spider-man 3). Oh well. Stay away!Can anyone verify if I got gypped?

This film was awful.There were 1 or maybe 2 funny bits and thats when they weren't spoofing stuff.Now i am not a huge fan of 300.don't start hating me.I can appreciate how well done it was but just wasn't entirely my type.Kevin Sorbo and Sean Maguire are good actors who deserve better.i hope Friedberg and Seltzer realise how much they suck and do something good and original.i heard they have written a biopic about Liberace.the 2 out of 10 is just me being generous.i had the displeasure of seeing it twice because my friend wanted to see it and he regretted it after. If it makes you feel any better i didn't pay either time.

Review title: heehaw great comedy and brilliant masterpiece
Review_body: The movie was really a great kick for those who insulted the Great Persia History... I really loved that movie and in my opinion the director really could beat the 300 movie which was a terrible mistake in the history of movie making. the guys in the movie played incredibly funny which had me and all of my friends in stitches. I scored the movie 10 which it deserves to get. Sean Maguire was awesome and he humiliated the 300 crap. You have to watch it guys it shows that stupid Spartans with their freaky outfit which suits the fagots! try to fight the great Persian army and all they got is 13 stupid fagot dancers!!!! try to fight (dance)!!!! The DEAD PIT was a great scene in which Leonidas which stands for lions like that I'd rather say loser's like kicks the whole famous Hollywood stars in. The way that Leonidas treats his child is like an animal which is manifest in the movie :)). I'd really wanna thank Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer for this gift to the Persia kingdom.

Words cannot express how much a disliked this film. The jokes are tired and old, the look a-likes are very poor, even the stage where it is shot looks like something i could have put up in my back garden.I sniggered at some of the jokes, but most of the scenes i was cringing, hoping that it would improve.Funny films to watch, "not another teen movie, Hot shots, Hot Shorts part deux," but defiantly not this film.Carmen Electrica is very hot, but her role in these films is growing tiresome.It doesn't happen that often but some films i just can't watch until the end, so i'm glad i only caught this on DVD, it's just a shame i'm not able to put lower than 1 out of 10.

This movie will guarantee make you laugh, but its not usually like the other scary movies, date movie, etc it only imitates 1 movie which is "300" In what the trailers you see, you will not see lots of the clips like the spider man shown and Rambo. This movie has the same plot as 300 which is receiving a message from the messenger and and having several battles against xeroxes army, in much in a more humor way. Although instead of REAL battles, they have a break dance and stomp competition and mom jokes, Through out the movie you will see judges just like American idol, only when the Spartans has competitions/battles, It has good quality I don't want to spoil too much, so ill just say 1 thing, the ending would of been better cause they over done it with the result of the Spartans death oh and 1 more thing, its only ONE HOUR LONG! just 60 minutes i still recommend you guys to watch it

It was all that you would expect from the previews. a comedy of a movie, 300, and some TV shows (I will not mention which, for i do not wish to spoil it for you guys). It is a movie that I would recommend for a single view, and then there is no reason to buy it on DVD.It has a wide variety of jokes, pokes fun at current events, and the movie 300. I found myself laughing a fair amount of the time, and I also found myself shaking my head a few times as well.a few faults with the movie, was all the gay jokes, there were just too many to be funny. there are a few spots where I found myself shaking my head at the distance they did to try and be funny with some of the jokes. there are a few gross jokes, and a few that could be considered to be abusive.i give the movie a 6 for it did make me laugh, but faults took away from the movie in my opinion.

300 was an excellent film. Meet the Spartans was the perfect insult to the film.As it is a parody film, it can be cut some slack with regards to the plot. However 90% of the 'jokes' were pop-culture references or parodies of films other than "Three Hundred".Several times over the course of the film, jokes were repeated over and over again in slightly different styles when in essence being the same old thing.One good use of this film is for interrogation rooms. Sit the victim in front of an IMAX screen and play this movie. You'll have them begging for mercy within seconds.

Review title: You would of though after epic movie the director's would of been shot but no there back with more rubbish.
Review_body: Right first of all i saw epic movie and it was the worst film i had ever seen so i really have no idea why i decided to see this (well i was in hope of seeing Carmen Electra in a sex scene) but i did. And by hell do i regret it there is nothing worse than a comedy that isn't funny ever if it is well made. But this isn't funny and could of been made better by a spastic with a camera phone, I laughed once in this movie and that was at myself for wasting 84 minutes of my life watching this pile of rubbish. The worst thing for me and most probably you as well is you just feel if the idea of one big parody was given to someone with talent it would of been a good film but instead it was given to a couple of idiots who Co-wrote scary movie.As a whole i recommend you save your money but of you really want to go and see this bring a Ipod it will be far better that way.

This spoof is up there with the first two Scary movies. Yeh there's some hits and misses, but the overall vibe was I had to watch certain scenes over and over again because the funny bone factor was high. The Bud man beer promo and the American idol/Tyra skits were cool. My favorite scene is short but sweet: The visit to the Oracle. The sex jokes are what make this one. If u r sexual stiff and uptight then don't watch it, but if u r sexually conscious, open minded, etc, then this flick will have you rolling! The 300 special effects at certain points are right on point. They had me fall out of my seat. The creators seem to be having fun making this one.

this movie is funny yes some things could have been cut down like the stomp the yard spartan dance off it got boring after awhile but let face it its stupid humor and the writers did not want this to be a smart comedy they just wanted you to go to the theater and forget your problems and watch Spartans dance to i will survive i applaud this comedy as trying to take turn form the the horrible epic movie which i regret seeing but i love this movie i never seen 300 but this is better to me the best scene was with the happy feet the peguin gets stuck in the rock and yells MY A$$ IS STUCK THAT MADE ME LAUGH THE MOST i love scary movie 2-4 but this is better then all of them combine cause what your missing is the way its done

Review title: Could Be the Greatest Movie Since Scary Movie 4
Review_body: If you've seen Scary Movie 4, Let Me Admit that this is possibly the greatest movie ever made. to others it may not be worth it watching it although if you watch it a little more you get used to it, the cameos of Famous People are memorable and the advertising campaigns sure show a lot of information for todays products. overall id give it and also my review two thumbs up for effort. in my less then positve terms some scenes may contain errors and the death pit thing is cool but it can get a little overused. if you are a Aaron and Jason fanatic then you'll probably be comfortable watching this movie on my perspective! overall id say still that this is the most hilarious movie!

Review title: Better than In the Name of the King
Review_body: Not the best or funniest movie ever, but still made me laugh a few times. And it was definitely better than the steaming pile of cat barf that is In the Name of the King. Which happens to be directed by a steaming pile of cat barf. With a dirty diaper in flames on top of it.The Paris Hilton bits were a bit stupid, but the Leonidas character was just hilarious. The scenes with his son made me laugh the most. The whole Rocky thing was pretty lame, also.All in all, it's not the worst movie ever, but could have been done a bit better.

This was easily one of the worst films i've seen so far this year. I was obviously made very cheaply and it really shows on the screen. The jokes are extremely childish yet I wouldn't recommend it for children as some bits are somewhat offencive..they have really missed the mark on this one which I was really hoping would be good as I usually love this style of film. Most of the gags in the film have been seen time and time again and by the end the audience was really switching off and the younger members of the audience just started throwing popcorn around as it was so bad. In short if you have to go to the cinema this weekend see something else.

Review title: a fantastic rape of the spartans, humour and all film
Review_body: There are people that have voted 10 for this..."film". I've voted 10 for few films, one of which being The Godfather. Do the people who have voted 10 for this piece of dog waste deserve a vote on IMDb? Are they familiar with any other comedy films in the world? Or are they 5 years old and therefore perhaps not mature enough to form a valid opinion? Because they will grow up and regret their decision. Anyway i didn't really see a plot to the film, mainly stabs at celebrities, stabs that are constant, unfunny and unsurprisingly predictable. This is all performed (i use that word loosely) under the guise of Spartans, who most people believe to be half naked bodybuilders who shout a lot. AS much as i hated the attempts at humour and the fact that this is classed as a comedy, what i hate the most is that the stupid people who enjoyed this probably believe that the spartans were really like the way they're portrayed in this "film" or in 300 for that matter. After the film i was confused, how can films like "there will be blood" and "american gangster" be made in the same country and year as this piece of sickening humourless rubbish.

Not a masterpiece, but quite enjoyable. My son loved it. I would not screen it for my wife and mother in law tough because of some profanities. Some scenes were hilarious (such as the duel between the penguin and Leonidas). My favorite part was when there was the roasting battle among the Spartans. Low budget movie worth watching in a winter rainy cold afternoon with your friends.

Review title: Excruciatingly unfunny. Should be a zero score.
Review_body: More from the unfunny writers and directors who gave us "Epic Movie" and "Date Movie" but this time there are no laughs to be found. And really, I was hoping it would be funny. The film is startlingly unoriginal and plays like a 3-min "Saturday Night Live" sketch that has been stretched out to 84 mins. Bad acting, terrible casting, worse special effects and a literally non-existent laugh-to-joke ratio, this film was torture to sit through. The directors couldn't even get the so-called celebrity "look-a-likes" right. Seriously, if they hadn't have said "Hey that's Paris Hilton" or "Ugly Betty" or "Lindsay Lohan" you would not have recognized the "celebrity." There is not one laugh in the entire 84 minutes. How this got through test screenings is beyond me. Does 20th Century Fox not read scripts anymore before they commit millions of dollars to a production?

Review title: Not as bad as I first thought it would be...
Review_body: I have to say that for the first time, since I've been using IMDb.com to see how good or bad a movie is (before actually watching the movie), I've been tricked by all the bad comments about this title. First of all, the movie is a parody. What can you guys expect from a parody? You are expecting incredible acting? A well planned plot? You know, you usually don't see this in parodies. I for one was a fan of the Scary Movie series (although as they progressed through the sequels, the movies were less and less funnier). This movie is WAY and I'm telling you WAY better than Epic Movie. You can't even compare Epic Movie with this one. Now Epic Movie was a really bad parody. Its jokes were not funny at all (most of them anyway). In "Meet the Spartans" you will see a movie that will follow the trail of the original movie (considered by some a master-piece, considered by others a gross exaggeration, in a Hollywood-style) and the adventures of the "heroes" in the movie will look very similar to the ones in 300.
