Of course, there are exaggerations. You will see a blend between the ancient times and the modern days (from time to time in the movie - e.g. the appearance of Britney Spears). What I did like most about this movie were the few, but excellent, "smart jokes" that were aimed strictly at the movie 300 and several of its features: E.g. :the fact that there were exactly 300 spartans and all were top-models. So all in all, I advise you to go and see this movie. If you don't like parodies, stay home and do something else or wait for it to appear on DVD at a cheap price. But if you are a parodies lover and if you watched 300 (at least once - I saw it twice) , this movie is a must see. It will definitely make you laugh for 80 full minutes out of 84 minutes.Have fun and don't let the comments get you down! I'll give it a 7 (because I did not like the ending part).
And it still made me laugh as much as when I first watched it.

Review title: PLEASE!!! NO! don't waste your time! I BEG YOU!!
Review_body: i didn't even pay to see this movie. i watched it online and thank Jesus Christ i didn't waste my money on this POS!! absolutely NOTHING about it was funny! it was just all pointless retarded men dancing and making gay jokes. after 5 minutes of this movie i was ready to turn it off, it was just so boring and unfunny. but i kept watching HOPING that something funny would happen! BUT IT DIDN'T! ...................................................................i would not recommend this movie to anyone! i wouldn't even recommend renting it!! if you want to see how badly this movie sucks without paying money just go to http://www.watch-movies.net! you will see exactly what i'm talking about!

A must see of 2008 if you like comedies.I don't care what some say but this film is very creative and witty minds work.First of all it is much more enjoyable than the far-fetched 300; characterisation, story and costumes reflect certain reality of ancient Greece which makes you laugh and laugh and laugh.I loved the fat Persian king and the masculine Spartan king; a sharp contrast between the two is definitely drawing attention to their sizes (incl their genitals), but not to their races on the contrary. :) Although the acting is superbly carried out, I guess it wouldn't be very difficult to replace the players with those from Mykonos and Lesbos.I give them 10 out of 10.**********

Review title: It isn't smart, it isn't witty, but that doesn't mean it's not funny
Review_body: I have to admit, I only saw this because I lost a coin toss with my friend when debating which movie to see. That said, I was pleasantly surprised. I actually laughed quite often. There were a lot of laughs, a lot of cultural spoofs, and everyone in the theater seemed to be having a great time. It was exactly what I expected, a 300 spoof with cultural references to other movies and societies, only funnier. I hadn't liked Date Movie or Epic Movie, so I was skeptical. But I was quickly won over and found myself very entertained. It's not intelligent humor, but still quite funny. It starts out good, gets better, than becomes actually really stupid, but overall, its a funny movie, and I recommend it if you like the "stupid humor" genre.

This is seriously the worst film I have ever seen! My biggest regret was not walking out of the theater after the first 5 min.The writing was pathetic. The acting was terrible. There was no storyline. Scenes that would have been funny--even were funny in the trailers--become uncomfortably long, and stupid. It's like pulling teeth. I thought Epic Movie was bad, I thought Date Movie was horrid, but neither of those pieces of crap hold a candle to the stench that is Meet The Spartans.If you have absolutely nothing better to do, and someone will pay you to watch it, don't. It's really that bad! Go rent Scary Movie 1 or 3. Or better yet, go see Rambo... I wish I had.

Review title: Like watching an extended episode of Mad TV...
Review_body: That pretty much sums it up. This movie would be more appropriate as a special episode of a sketch show like Mad TV. Paying to watch this in the theaters is totally worthless. I will not rule out possibilities of getting it on DVD, though. It has some funny moments, but not all that funny. Some parts that were supposed to be funny never got a laugh out of anyone in the theater, while some made everyone giggle in the least.As far as acting is concerned, It is unlikely that anyone would be expecting Oscar-winning acting off such a film. Suffice to say, when asked for, the actors deliver a fulfilling act. The problem is not with the actors. It is with the script. Every other scene, I would go "I could have made this soo much funnier". So yeah, there we have it. But overall, I would say I liked this better than Epic Movie and Date Movie. Nowhere near the scary movies though.So, bottom line, do not waste your time and money watching this in the theaters. Wait for it on DVD or Star Movies. On a plus side, Mad TV fans (like me) will enjoy the antiques of Nicole Parker in the film.

I cannot believe that this kitschy, unintelligent, cheap-shot excuse for entertainment was committed to celluloid. If you've seen the movie's trailer, you've been treated to most of the gags already. If you haven't seen any of the original films it parodies, or are unaware of the pop culture references it pokes fun at (Britney and K-Fed, anyone?), don't worry, the filmmakers are considerate enough to hit you over the head with them. If you appreciated any of the films it desperately tries to make jokes from, then by all means, avoid it. I don't blame the actors,writers or director for the grievous experience I had watching this film. I blame myself. It was an extremely regrettable act, and you would do yourself a favor not making the same mistake.

Review title: Simply the worst movie I have EVER seen
Review_body: Like my summary says, its the worst movie I have ever seen. And I'm not saying that in the impulsive kinda way. I'm saying it in the: "I thought it over and I cant think of a worse movie than this" kinda way. The jokes are terrible and since its a non-stop stream of jokes there's really no part of the movie which isn't terrible.I suppose I should give some credit to the film makers that the props used in the film are pretty decent. But then again, if everything looked as if it were made out of cardboard I at least would have had something to laugh about.Avoid this at all cost. If I had the choice of paying 10 to watch this movie or paying 10 to spend the duration of the entire movie (Which thankfully isn't that long) playing with two paperclips I'd go for the paperclips, all the way.

Four of the adults in our family attended this movie tonight. Three males and one female, aged 29 to 55, all agreed that this show only deserves a rating of "1". The general consensus was that it may very well be the worst movie any of us have ever seen. There are actually a couple of sincerely humorous bits in the movie, but not enough to make it worth the admission. When other family members were asked who might like the movie, comments were "maybe the blind and deaf" (because they would be spared) or maybe someone between 6th and 9th grade. However, the subject matter is not appropriate for young people. The MPAA rating is "PG-13", but I think parents should think twice before showing this to younger family members. The jokes are often of a sexual nature and violence is portrayed, although in ridiculous ways. Of course, a spoof of "The 300" is expected to have violence of some sort. Viewers will understand more of the "jokes" if they have already seen "The 300", but it's not entirely necessary if you know a little about its plot. Kevin Sorbo and Carmen Electra are the best known actors in the film; what a comedown. We'd much rather see Sorbo in Andromeda or Hercules. If you're determined to see what it's like, I suggest waiting for the DVD. Better yet, wait until someone else rents it and watch with him! Once you decide to watch it to the end, stay through the credits. Like many of the newer shows, the credits have some extra things to watch. This one actually highlights some items more entertaining than the film itself.

Review title: One of the greatest movies ever
Review_body: For those of you intelligent enough out there to have studied the origin of Satire and the difference between Juvenalian and Horatian Satire, you find this to be one of the most brilliant examples of Juvenalian Satire that there is out there. There are some spoilers in this so be careful if you don't want some of the movie revealed. This movie rips on so very many things, that I suggest that you buy it(which I don't sell videos) just to watch it and try and catch the multitudes of movies that it destroys in this biting satire. The dance movies alone that are for ADD people in the first place who are horny slobs who might as well rent a soft porno instead(example the movie "Honey") rather than waste their time on that crap will love the satire that this movie does to most dance shows as well as the brain dead American Idol which sadly more people vote on than the American Precidency which just shows how stupid and retarded our nation has become. Oh if there really were a pit of death for people like Britney, Helen Degenerate(Degeneres if you must spell her name right) who isn't even funny as well as Dana Cook who also isn't funny, the world would be a better place. And of course Bush should have long been pushed into it like he was in the movie. So many people go into the pit of Death but still not enough but how many can you push in within one movie? This movie is for the true intellectuals who love satire and it is only too bad Paris didn't get pushed in as well!! And for all the ignorant Critics of this movie, the only thing I can say is get a braincell and YOU GOT SERVED!!

Review title: Hilarious and accurate to field life.
Review_body:
Look, it was hilarious. Still one of my favorite movies today.
And yes I said it was accurate to field life. Which one of my fellow vets never locked arms and skipped through the field with their battle buddies singing songs? None of you, that's what I thought.

Review title: This Deserves Less than a Zero...
Review_body: Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear... I just got back from this sorry, sad excuse for a movie. Basically this movie "spoofs" "300", "Happy Feet", "Transformers", and other smash hits at the box office, but fails oh so miserably at doing so. So you take the mostly nude and ripped men from "300" and give them the "Meet the Spartans" twist and gay jokes ensue. How original; I NEVER saw that coming! Ugh... Oh, black gangster jokes are riddled through the film as well. Haha! I never saw anything like this before... Ugh...once again. The acting in this film is OK I suppose but then it's really hard to judge acting when the material is really worse than something written by an three year old with ADD. I suppose one "good" thing about the film is that visually it looks alright and not like it was made with a budget of $47.89. No millions added to that please. Another "bright" side is that the narrator every now and then says something remotely worthy of a chuckle, something the actors themselves never get. Honestly, I laughed aloud once and it may have been a bit forced... but I digress. As a film student I can't really begin to say just how utterly bad this movie was. I'm only 16 and I could write, cast, direct, and edit a better film and to be honest I'd be embarrassed to even tag my name onto "Meet the Spartans" credits. What else can I rant on about this film? Oh yes, I didn't think it was possible but this makes "Epic Movie" look as good as "Juno." Now there's a movie to spend $7 on! This film over killed so many jokes. I struggle to imagine how creativity can truly be at that much of loss in the writer's room! When in doubt I guess throw in a gay, toilet, or another gay joke! That or drag a dumb dance off scene to make it seem like 15 minutes when it's really about 4 or 5. Oh, Carmen Electra was in it again, like she is in all of these spoof movies, so for any Carmen Electra fans, there ya go. I will end on this note: Save your money, go see "Juno" or "Cloverfield" or "Rambo", but don't waste your money on or give anymore money the creators of this horrid excuse for a movie. "Meet the Spartans" gets -5345634/10.

Have you ever seen one of those films that is so bad that it's cringe-worthy? There is the deliberate cringe-worthiness that is sometimes deliberately done to great effect in some recent comedy series (eg, The Office, curb Your Enthusiasm, etc), but I am not talking about that.This movie is so bad it had me feeling embarrassed for all those people involved. I felt embarrassed for the actors, the movie creators, even the other people watching the movie. I felt embarrassed for Americans, having this movie represent them over-seas. THAT is how bad it is.The movie is so bad, that its almost a perverse desire to watch it. It's like when you used to look at pictures of really nasty things, like dead people just to see what its like at the EXTREME end of the spectrum of life. This is the movie version of that.I seriously struggle to understand how this movie was able to be funded, and released. Surely the creators didn't genuinely think that what they were doing was funny? I don't know how its possible to be so un-funny. No one cannot be that detached from reality, can they?. It makes me even more mad to know that somewhere someone is making movies like this and getting a lot of money for it? Even I...with no script writing experience could do a better job than this. I think a 10 year old kid probably could. How is it even possible for someone to be in a situation where they can make such bad movies? I think this movie does have a good point though. Its like a motivational film. Upon seeing how bad this movie was, it makes people want to become film makers, and gives them the confidence to KNOW that even they could do better than this. Thats the only thing I can think of to justify this movies release...and existence!!

Review title: Not Worth Wasting A Minute Over
Review_body: This movie, or at least the DVD of it, has been marketed big style. Not surprisingly I don't remember the theatrical release being played up so much! I won't comment on specifics (spoilers) as undoubtedly most people want to make up their own mind. What I will say is that this is the least funny film I have EVER seen. I am prepared to bet that a theatre full of your average moviegoers (is that how you spell it? If not, sic) would find more laughs in Saving Private Ryan than this deplorable effort.The Scary Movie films that came before this were, at best, hit and miss. Sadly, whoever wrote this screenplay decided to opt for the carpet-bomb approach and included as many poorly conceived pop culture references as possible without first having them proof read by comedy writers. Some bright spark in the production team actually thought that having numerous female cast members' legs fall open to reveal a blurred "Britney shot" would be utterly hilarious. How wrong they were. What we have as a result is the worst type of infantile garbage that even infants wouldn't find funny, nor for that matter will most teenagers.If I had wanted to spend 90 minutes growing increasingly more depressed I would have visited the grave of my beloved gerbil, Alan. As it stands, after viewing this "movie" I am left with the dread feeling the nothing will ever be right in the world again. Oh, the humanity.If you saw this movie and hated it, I'm sorry that this review came too late. If you saw this movie and loved it, well, I'm just sorry.

Review title: a must-see for all those who are desperate for some quality comedy!!!!!!
Review_body: After setting a very high standard for quality comedies with Date Movie and Epic Movie, 2 of the most respected directors in Hollywood Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzerare back with yet another insanely funny spoof "Meet The Spartans" and I have to say that this is EVEN better than the last two! (Who would have thought?)Unlike other recent comedies (Superbad anyone?) the jokes are classy and clever and non-stop from start to finish. Not a second goes by without the audience laughing their heads off to the quality comedy they are watching. Almost everyone in the theater I watched it was rolling on the ground from laughter. A few losers walked out after a few minutes which just goes to show that there's no pleasing EVERYONE.Overall an extremely funny spoof (possibly even better than Airplane!) that is a must-see for everyone, even if comedy is not your thing, you still need to watch this as it may change the way you look at comedies.A brilliant 10/10!

Review title: Worst piece of horseshit ever made in the entire time and age of film-making
Review_body: I cannot really describe in words how awful this movie is, but i will try. I would rather have intercourse with Rosie O'Donnel then to watch it again. Plan 9 from outer space was funnier then this... I know there's about 200 comments on this, probably 198 of them hate this movie as much as i do. Then why do you Americans WATCH IT IN THE CINEMA? this was f*in top at the box office when it was released, how is that possible?????????? I watched about half of Epic Movie and hated it as much as this one, therefor i started watching meet the Spartans so i could see how bad it is. If anyone are thinking the same thing as me and are about to see this just to humor yourself on how bad it is, Don't. It's not worth it, this is time that you could have spent starring in to the wall in stead. I watched 30 minutes into this and i got physically ill. If the writer of this movie was trying to make the most unfunny awful piece of horseshit in history. BRAVO you did well

I mean, really, why are Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer allowed to make such utter fools of themselves? These movies have gotten so bad that people aren't even laughing at how terrible they are, now it's more of a constant groaning at the worse than amateur acting and writing. Sure, in Epic Movie there were one or two genuinely funny moments, but those were in the first ten minutes. Somebody should ban these guys from making movies cos they just don't seem to understand how bad they are.The "jokes" are painfully obvious and executed with such agonizingly poor acting you might as well be watching 10 year olds act it out. No, I'm sorry, that's insulting the kids! This movie is another nail in the coffin for this pair of "Comedy Directors", and I use the term comedy loosely. The question is, just how many nails can one coffin hold? There are so many at this stage.I know I've only addressed the acting and the writing, you may be asking "what about the plot?". Well, you already saw the plot. This movie is a cheap rip off of 300 and I don't think anybody would hold it against the makers of 300 for suing the makers of this movie. In fact, I would welcome it with open arms!Don't waste your money, don't even bother to let this movie waste your time. I would give this movie a worse rating but this site only lets you go down as far as 1.

Review title: Why these writers don't get it.
Review_body: These guys just don't understand what is funny.Take for instance the Zucker brothers. They are who brought us such great spoofs as "Top Secret," "Airplane," the "Naked Gun" series, and "BaseketBall." When they parody films, they parody the GENRE of the film. If it's a Police who done it, then they use all of the clichés from that genre.The same can be said for the Waynes Brothers who collaborated with these tards on the first two Scary Movies. They spoof the "horror" genre or the "hood" genre in the case of "Don't be a Menace." Ultimately they ran out of movies to spoof and the Zucker brothers tried to save it to no avail.The problem with these writers is they don't understand that people don't want to see pop culture all throughout the movie. It wasn't funny when Shrek showed up as a baby! It WAS funny when the leading man said "Walk with me over to the pit of death." That's because it showed how ridiculous the real scene was in "300." One of the worst moments that made me jump out of my seat and almost leave was when a character said that Carmen Electra's character was "venomous." Carmen then starts to turn into Venom from Spider-Man. Another character then states, word for word, "yeah, like Topy Mcguire in Spider-Man three. Are you so retarded in your writing that you have to point out your joke that wasn't even funny to begin with.Come on guys, just give it up. Go be producers because your films obviously make money. But please, you ratings are all below three. Take a hint and please let this genre go.

To put it into words.DO NOT WATCH THIS FILM!!!The director's careers should have been revoked a long time ago.The only enjoyable bit of this movie (if I dare call it such a thing)are the end credits. What were they thinking!!!This happens to be the only 'comedy' I have ever kept a straight face for throughout, which is rare for me as I even laugh at the Excorsist.The only words to describe the directors - *Sell Outs*Just Don't Watch It.

Review title: Go see Cloverfield and don't waste your money.
Review_body: All I can say about this movie is Please don't waste your money!! THe movie starts out really good but eventually it just starts dragging out its jokes until they just get lame, This movie is kind of like that person in school who tells a really good joke, but then it also has the other person who completely takes the joke and ruins it. To sum it up everything is just dragged out way too much and many of the same jokes are repeated way to often, Don't get me wrong it also contains some extremely funny spoofs, but just wait to rent it so you don't waste your money on the other 75% garbage. If you really want to enjoy yourselves just go see Cloverfield or some other comedy thats on your list and pass this one up until you can rent it for around 3$

This was one of the worst films I can say I have ever seen in my lifetime!!! The spoofs were corny and stupid and the movie was like an hour long. The movie is like an hour of hell. I hope they never make a movie this bad again!!! I also would like to see a really good spoof movie in the future... i really enjoyed scary movie 1 and 2. One way to solve the problem is to get the Wayans bros. back into spoofing too.Overall .5 out of 10 (yes .5) get ready for a horrible ride of spoofs!!

Just as bad as the movie they are trying to make fun of. Terrible acting, cinematography, plot, storytelling, overall direction and so on. The only thing that makes this movie better than the pathetic recreation of the battle at Thermopile ("300") is that it is meant to be a comedy. I guess if you are really bored and have plenty of money to spend, but no nearby charity to donate $9 to, and the only movie that is playing is this one, then sure, go see it. Otherwise, be wise, stay away, and do something better with your life. Try, for example watching some international, or domestic independent films. There is a lot more out there than Hollywood.

Review title: Terrible, Humorless, a waste of time.
Review_body: A crude, horribly put together film. I couldn't even finish watching it - it doesn't even pass as a comedy. I wasted an hour of my life on this film, and that was more than enough. There was absolutely no humor to be found, if there was any - it is in how awful this movie is. Meet the Spartans should be played as a demonstration on 'how not to make a comedy'. It's just that bad. I think you get my point.They continually put in celebrities to poke fun at them, but that didn't work even the slightest. Too many bodily fluids we don't need to see, and pointless jokes. This is obviously the product of someone with too much time on their hands, and no sense of humor. I hope no one else wastes their money and sanity trying to sit through this.Meet The Spartans is now added to my list of 'worst movies of all time'.

Review title: Terrible movie, but what do you expect?
Review_body: This was easily the worst movie I have ever seen. Since Cloverfield was closed, I decided to go to this instead, knowing it would be dreadful. What followed was an awful experience. The jokes are aimed for ten-year-old kids who will laugh at anything. The plot was a pathetic rip-off of 300. Epic Movie was a phenomenon compared to this. The writers of these god-awful parodies are losing ideas. Sure, the Scary Movie series was okay, but after the third one, the writers began filling the void of good acting and funny slapstick comedy with obvious references to celebrities and TV shows. This all only leads me to believe that Meet the Spartans was not meant to be any good. The idiots who wrote it probably figured that an audience of immature kids would love it. Hey, every film writer screws up occasionally. What about George Lucas and Howard the Duck? The main problem is that these parody movies are vile, 90-minute crap-o-ramas that resort to language and dirty jokes to deliver a strained laugh. I didn't laugh. I left halfway through the movie.

Who exactly are these idiots who give Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer money to make films? If they do have to exist in the same reality with us, the normal people, why in the gods name are they allowed to make films? we need to to stop this! It is a crime against humanity. I have never been physically affected by a movie. Until now. It made my stomach hurt.The only reason why I watched it was curiosity. I have seen the reviews and i thought I had to see for myself what is so wrong with this movie. And it was a mistake. Don't do it. It just isn't worth it. I can appreciate a trash movie, but this is below trash category.. Much, much below..Now, if you'll excuse me, I am going to vomit again.

I know i shouldn't even comment as i haven't even seen the film yet, however it looks exactly the same as Scary Movie 3/4 (the first 2 were tolerable!)Date Movie, Epic Movie all of which weren't remotely funny plus others i just can't be bothered tio think of. And i wonder who watched these thought they where funny and decided to do YET again another spoof film. Its always the same predictable jokes and characters, i saw the trailer and that was enough to decide NOPE, Ain't WATCHING IT. Please please please, whoever is producing or thinking of producing another spoof film for 2009, Don't. Leave it with the Airplanes and Naked gun, enoughs enough.

By far the worst movie i have ever seen! Silly, childish and rarely funny jokes that seemed to make this film last forever and made me feel embarrassed for the actors! The only people i would advise Meet The Spartans too are children under the age of 11 as these were the only ones laughing in the cinema. I'm at a loss for words when trying to explain how bad this movie is as the only ones that come to mind are that of the profanity variety and am sure they would not be appreciated by most. The people involved in this films production should be shot for releasing this comedy of errors and captivating us with a rather good trailer which made me want to watch this crap! This movie should be revoked and everyone who went to see it should be presented with a formal apology and refund from the creators of this nightmare. 1/10 and only because you can't give 0/10

This was by far the worse ____ movie ever. Epic movie makes this look good. The acting was far below mediocre, the script was just a complete copy of 300's events except changed to be "funny". I didn't laugh a single time in the entire movie. It has gross moments, just spit and slime, apparently hilarious moments. Honestly, I'd watch any comedy movie available and still manage through, but this was by far the worst comedy movie I've seen all year. They spoof game shows throughout the show, not one is funny. Honestly, save your money and go see a decent movie. Watching the trailer for this movie makes it look hilarious, but after 100 lame ass jokes, even the remotely funny ones don't save the movie.

Oh the horror! What a movie. One thing is for sure, it is not what I expected. Sean Maguire tries to be funny but there's nothing sadder than a struggling punchline that doesn't deliver. This was too little of a parody to the blockbuster 300. Am sorry to say this but this is one of the gayest flicks you'll ever see. I seriously had to look at its makers.This movie is not even worth watching for free. Just stick to scary movie and the likes and don't dare watch this. And don't be fooled by the calibre of actors, they really do not pull it off. For the sake of your appetite for comedy. Enough said, just look for 'scary movie 4' and 'kungfu hustle'

Somehow i managed to watch this movie, just because there was Carmen Electra in it.....:D But still she was not that impressive. Nothing new, same old booty moves and seducing looks but except for one scene where Carmen Electra is laying on a table with only tomatoes covering her nipples and a slice of pizza covering her crotch. Was expecting a bit more from her...was disappointed! And, about this movie i say......No storyline,Worst ever dialog's,Bad screenplay. At times u would just sit and scratch your head, thinking what the hell is going on...i cant even say its funny! its just so boring......I suggest you to watch this movie only if you want to add a movie in your top worst list. ha ha :D They made a spoof of themselves... Don't waste time downloading it, If u already did; delete it. If u purchased a DVD, break it & shoot yourself, for buying such a worst ever movie... before reading this comment on IMDb...:P Conclusion: this movie is strictly avoidable!

A lot didn't make sense but so long as you laugh with comedies thats the thing story lines don't matter (esspeicially for parody's)as long as you laugh a lot its good. i though Leonidas was SO funny the way he deliver some of the lines was great. LOL Paris Hilton "I'm a Hilton I don't bow, but I do bend over." Nobody i know hated it. my brother LOVED it says it was the funniest film he's ever seen. its not the funniest film i've seen but it is good i would have given it 7 or 8 but everyone said give it ten so i did. its funnier than scary movie. critical just because the characters are all over the place just as long as its funny, jeez lighten up.

I absolutely love parody. It's my favorite genre. From Spaceballs to Airplane!, I love watching them. To such a fan of classic parody, this film is a kick in the balls.This film is not only unfunny, it is the opposite of anything even remotely funny. I honestly think it's fun to watch bad films, but there is nothing fun about this piece of crap. It is my all time least favorite film. The film starts with the only part of the film you might be able smile at, with a few jokes. From there the film is riddled with unclever sex jokes and pop culture references that already aren't funny, and will make absolutely no since a few years down the road. I've seen Friedberg and Seltzer's other big film, Epic Movie, and didn't really like it. But where that film seemed like trying and failing, this film just seemed like they has given up trying to be clever. I would avoid this movie at all cost.

If you think this is a good film, then you must be idiotic! There are crude jokes, with a little laugh, advertisements, everything is flawed! Aaron Seltzer: I have one word for you: Refresh! Refreshing is a good way to make your career pop up again, but this is one huge piece of s**t! You make awful sequels like Smokey and the Bandit 3 and Robocop 3 look like blockbuster hits because of you! Aaron Seltzer: You are pathetic. Unless you come up with a better idea even more than your latest film, I've seen enough.Comedy: 1/10 Spoof: 1/10 Success: 1/10 Creativity: 1/10Overall: an F--- (1/10).

Review title: This "movie" gives parodies a bad name
Review_body: This has got to be the worst movie I have ever seen, and believe me, I have seen many bad movies. The humor is absolutely pathetic. And before some of you accuse me that I didn't understand this movie, I want to tell you that I love parodies, and that I didn't care much for "300". Also, I am 24 years old, not 50 or more. Trust me, there is nothing to understand about this movie. There is no excuse for this POS. It feels like the script for this movie was written by a 13 year old. These days everybody thinks they can make a movie.The only reason I watched it until the end was because I couldn't believe how bad it is, I just wanted to see how low you could get. This movie gives parodies a bad name. In fact, this movie gives movies a bad name. It is a complete waste of money and time. They might have been better off showing a piece of crap on a plate for the entire length of the movie, I think it would have been less repulsive. The sooner I can forget this movie, the better. The reason I'm writing this review is to tell you this: please people, stop paying to see crappy movies like this, let them just go out of business because they deserve it.

Review title: One of the worst films I ever saw
Review_body: Please, 'PLEASE' refrain from seeing this movie. It will be an utter waste of time. Surprising what load of wanton, brazen, offensive comedies come out of Hollywood! not even 5 minutes in the movie, it became so boring and the comic lines and reliefs were abysmal. It was my biggest mistake in spending money for buying the DVD. But now I know. Additionally, I think its not worth the effort trying to make parodies out of movies which themselves do not come up to the standards of making any considerable mark in the annals of movie history and fame. Saying any more about the movie would be spilling the beans, and I would not like to do so. My advise to anybody who is forced to watch this is to avoid under all circumstances and rather watch a dubbed Chinese movie or any other language film with subtitles. The pain would certainly be less.

Review title: Unlike the huge majority of the people, I found this pretty funny!!
Review_body: This movie is disgusting and inappropriate, but not that much. It is crude but a 13 year old is old enough to watch this, although it is inappropriate to kids younger than 13. I do not recommend this movie to girls or women because they wont think its funny. This movie is only funny to guys because the comic level is pretty disgusting for women. Vomit is talked about in this movie, and I specially recommend to people older than 13 who've already seen the movie "300". I would not recommend anyone to buy this movie. Just rent the movie,buy a six pack for you and a root beer for your son, watch the movie have good laughs then go to sleep.'Meet The Spartans" is funny and I recommend this to guys over 13.

I enjoyed Meet the Spartans more than I expected.Much of the humor was pedestrian and low, but it definitely had good points. It was a bow to many current popular establishments, and well, rather a slap at a few others. Since I agreed for the most part with the direction of the slaps, I laughed.The acting-as actors and actresses did a fine job for the most part and are to be congratulated. The Spartans were funny and did the best possible job with the script offered. I could have done without their rendition of Xerses and the penguin - ugh! The references to American Idol were terrific, and Dancing with the Spartans was great and the skipping had me in stitches. The king of Sparta was did a good job, and the Queen was exactly what was expected. It would have been great to see what Mel Brooks would have made of the material.

Review title: Easily one of the worst movies I have seen
Review_body: Where do I start? Well, let's kick off with the good sides. But trust me, there isn't many. Only one: I can remember only one part where I actually laughed a bitWell, first of all, it wasn't really "funny". This is what this movie should have been, right? I didn't find it funny, but my brother and sister did. I guess they have a weird taste of humorThe scene at the "Pit of Death" was way too overdone. It last for so long I actually got bored with it.The acting wasn't especially good but it'll do. But that doesn't mean I liked the acting. Nonono!I can only think of one thing about this movie and it begins with C and ends with a P. And it's not cheap.No wait, it isI can't really see where did they use all of the money they were given? I mean, the set looked like in a school play, and the scene with the blue screen? Do they think that's funny??The beginning with the penguin... well, it was badly made. They could have animated it better. And the whole idea of a man licking penguin's balls and then receiving... something white on his face is disgusting. And therefore not funnyThe transformers-cube-car-thingy-whatever-you-want-to-call-it! Technically it was quite well made, but that cannot save this movie from what it isMy verdict... well, if you like a badly made, bad movie with bad humor, it's your own fault, I'm not blaming you if you actually like it. There are some people who find this kind of movie very entertaining and like it very much.Sadly I'm not one of them

Review title: So what did I just watch?
Review_body: OK, so first thing's first, this movie is pure trash. After watching Friedberg and Seltzer's timeless classic 'Epic Movie' (2007), I felt a burning desire to tear off my skin and jump into an acid bath. 'Meet the Spartans' is no better. Even entering this movie with the lowest possible expectation, these douche bags still managed to surprise me.The plot is simply a scene-by-scene remake of '300' (2007), albeit with nonsensical inclusions such as towel-whipping, homosexual kissing, child bashing, ogre babies, Ugly Betty and of course three separate scenes where some sort of fight scene is judged by the panel of American Idol, America's Next Top Model, and some other reality show that eludes me right now.The movie mostly takes place in an awful set covered in sand with a few Styrofoam rocks placed around. This would be forgivable if the movie's actual material was up to scratch (which it isn't). There's only so much undue and misplaced insults to various celebrities such as Paris Hilton that one can properly ingest per scene; and Friedberg and Seltzer go into overdrive here. I nearly lost it when I saw Rocky get a botox needle shoved in his head, and when the "fat guy from Borat" transformed into Xerxetron from putting the "Transformer cube" in a low-rider. This isn't to take anything away from the guy who inexplicably turns into the Sandman from Spider-Man 3, who gets shat on by a cat and sucked into a dust-buster while exclaiming "dust-buster bitch!" This movie is utter balls.I think I should also mention that the film goes for about one hour. Then the credits roll, over a reprise of the ENTIRE cast singing "I will survive". Then it goes to black and more credits roll. But it gets better; after this there is a reel of what I read are meant to be deleted scenes, but really I had a tough time trying to fathom just what I was watching. It's like seeing the whole movie again, condensed to ten minutes, with the scenes shuffled. Then it goes to black again and more credits roll. It's astounding, it really is.On to the acting. Well, I suppose it works, but the dialogue and some of the things the actors have to put themselves through is truly embarrassing for them. I felt bad when the cast had to crack "Yo Momma" jokes and break dance. I really did.I guess I could keep going, but there really is no point. Put simply, only see this movie if you have a curiosity to know why it is considered so bad. I just can't imagine this being enjoyed by anyone.

Review title: The worst movie of all time.
Review_body: Believe me. You don't want to watch this. After viewing this, you would kill to have your 2 wasted hours back.Acting : 0/10. I would not even call this acting. I've seen better interpretation in Primary School improvisation shows. Believe me, it's THAT bad.Humour : 0/10. I didn't laughed once. The same old tired and uninspired attempt at comedy are melt down during the whole movie. It's painfully ridicule. Believe me, it's THAT bad.Story & characters : 0/10. An unorganized mess of useless characters and plot points. Believe me, it's THAT bad.Artistic value : 0/10. My kinder garden's drawings looks better than these sets. Believe me, it's THAT bad.Production value : 0/10 . I've seen better production quality on family video footage. Believe me, it's THAT bad.Overall:0/10. Believe me it's THAT bad.

This movie is so funny. I didn't see it at a theater or rent it. I was lucky enough to buy the DVD from a rental store for 5 bucks, based on seeing the previews, and have watched this hilarious piece of spoof art, at least 20+ times... I love it ! My wife even loves it too. If I need to cheer myself up and laugh a little, this movie works for me. If you like spoof movies similar to Airplane, Police Squad, Scary Movie series, Hotshots, History of the World,... You should be well pleased by the mountain of wit and humor put into this spoof. This movie is one of the greats. Don't be swayed by the "Uptight's" who lack a sense of humor. They need laying... either in the bedroom or in a coffin.

Next time I will NOT watch a movie on a whim without knowing a little more about it. Here's how bad this movie is - I had FREE tickets and it wasn't worth the price of admission. Do NOT waste your time, do something much more interesting - watch paint dry.The "jokes" are old. I have heard better "yo mama is SO fat jokes" in any number of places. There were many crude jokes, but the worst part was the gross, spewing of nasty substances.The ONLY funny / surprising scene is the the "dance off" showdown. I actually smiled a couple of times there. There were a couple of "pop culture" references that were mildly amusing.The actor who played Leonidas did a GREAT imitation of the guy in "300". He was spot on. How does one write TEN lines in a review of a "comedy" that doesn't have ten good laughs??

I thought this movie was very funny. The actors were very sexy and it blows movies like Not Another Teen Movie and Epic Movie out of the water. I recommend you stay after the credits. The action could have been better but its more of a spoof so you expect it to be bad. I haven't laughed so hard in a long time. I won't blow the movie for you but there are some shocking things that happen. The Britney parody (which everyone has seen in the commercial) keeps laughing. It's like Mad TV or SNL had a movie and it was based on 300. Thats how I would describe this movie. It rocked. It reminded me of Mel Brooks Space Balls and Robin Hood Men in tights. If I hadn't of seen the credits I'd have sworn Mel Brooks was behind it.

Review title: Come on, just enjoy it and laugh!
Review_body: No one is a bigger snob about spoof movies than I am so me giving this a good rating is because I truly believe this flick is good. Yes it is a part of the same universe of absolute trash movies by the friedburg/Seltzer duo but this one genuinely made me laugh. Superb cast if this were any other kind of movie. The sexy Carmen Electra is funny as always and it's awesome that a woman so talented and beautiful can do such low brow jokes. (See Scary Movie 3-she takes a 30 second dook in front of an entire room full of people and still walks away sexy as ever) Deidrich Bader is a riot; the scene where he says, "I must warn you, I suffer from premature EJAC-" and makes the oh face had me rolling. Sean Maguire is an amazing actor as always.Look, this movie is stupid. Very stupid. But that's OK. Not every movie can be a Zucker brothers movie. You can tell that a bunch of talented people had a really great time making a really fun movie. It wasn't made to win Oscars. If you can't just laugh at this and turn off your cool guy internet reviewing persona then you are living an empty sad life. Just laugh. Just have fun with it."High fives for the women, and open mouth tongue kisses for the men."

After Epic Movie failed my watching test, I decided to give Meet the Spartans a try. The movie started off funny, watching Leonidas grow up, and into the Pit of Death scene. But about halfway through that scene, where they should have ended it, they started making the jokes longer and just dumber. The worst part was they didn't even stay on track. They started as a parody of 300, a big epic adventure/action movie, and broke down into parodying whatever they could grab, including the whole genre of dance battling and insult battling. Most of the jokes seem like they were aimed at kids, but at the same time were too "adult" for most kids. All in all, I'd say skip this unless you're really really drunk.

Review title: Sparta w/ flair and substance for modern day ^_^
Review_body: Spartan culture references and Wayan's bros. fanatics aside, this movie was good.To put it into perspective, I did not particularly like Scary Movie 1  the supposedly black homosexual was obviously "too gay" ( :D ) from the start. You could see that what most of the char's got, they tried to put spins on it  how else would a supposed "mentally challenged" friend get on the police force? Affirmative action would probably never risk people's safety that way :).I never saw 300, either. I figured all these "researched" historically accurate movies are a bunch of B.S.  no fault of the director Or screen-writerjust their "capitalist overlords" xD :D. I hated Saving Private Ryan. One more hit: it was kinda anti-climatic, sort of like Donnie Darko; you save Ryan/you get to the point in time where the bunny emerges, and what happens? "durlet's kill Donnie, because he's so likable"/"hey. Let's have a big gun battle! That'll off-set the whole long, drawn out, and personable conundrum we've been fleshing out this Entiremovie! ^_^" :PAnyway, I loved Meet the Spartans more than anything from when I last saw a movie in theatersin the year 2001; ever since then, even the funny ones have been below-par, in my opinion.If one were to compare the pit of death with the disposal button to an actual pit trap, very nice. If you knew that Spartans were always the upstarts of the Greek world and preferredactivities rather than with some camp followers, then you have the basis of the movie, no matter how shallow. But it is true, that this movie was very shallow. Take into consideration, however, modern-day ethics with Spartan values, and you have this movie  an Excellent conundrum of having "the next best Spartan" or w/e show with the girl showing her uh, stuff to the winner; or having Xerxes with T-mobile (or w/e service), with his "top 5". Hilarious. If ancient days had such (tele-) communications, battles would be a lot bloodier and/or wars a lot shorter :|.With the guy being treasonous with a dummies guide, that would be your irreverent look at how stupid some court-people  now politicians  would be for a last grasp at power.The moral of today's story is kids, don't look at Hollywood for substance. I.e. Titanic (for the tragic history of some dumbernice, people who never took a navigation course in winter :| ) or stuff like Scary Movie, which Tries to make fun of other dumb Hollywood movies, which Already lack the substance necessary to make it relevant :P.If you're looking for relevance, read a bookpreferably non-fiction (fiction is for escaping, not learning :) ;) ) ; if you're looking for Entertainment, mixed with your knowledge, see a movie :P.All in all, Meet the Spartans takes a step in the right direction ever since the (good ol') days of Mel Brooks and the Zuckerman Brothers (Airplane, Young Frankenstein  reversed, respectively), whereas comedy has taken a rather sedate tone ever since "Those peoplein the axis of evil" (-George Bush, Jr.) "ruined" our twin towersand since the day that (America's) gov't has become more totalitarianIf you want "enlightened" comedy, see this movie. If you want more of the same stuff that's been pumped out since the liberty (that our forefather's (in America) gave us)s' deterioration, see Scary movie."And that's all I have to say About that." (-Weird Al, Gump)

Review title: I wish I had read this page before I went.
Review_body: I love spoofs. Htey are one of my favorite forms of entertainment. Whether it's "Scary Movie" or "Weird" Al, a spoof is just a bit of good clean fun.Meet The Spartans is the antithesis of a good spoof. It's so bad that it isn't even good at being bad.For those who haven't already figured it out, this is supposed to be a spoof of 300, which I thought was an excellent film. The film in and of itself was perfect fodder for a spoof. Unfortunately, Spartans doesn't do enough with it. Some of the ideas in this movie were good, but they weren't brought out. Instead there is nothing but a mess. One quality of a good spoof is it's references to pop culture, and Spartans even manages to screw that up. The references are few and far between, and to make up for this lack, what few there are are drawn out so as to be ludicrous. I actually fell asleep for the last 10 minutes of the movie, which I cannot ever remember doing. The best part of this movie is that it not even 90 minutes long.PLEASE do yourself a favor, stay away. Stay far away. If you really like torture, save the $10 and just shove bamboo shoots under your fingernails.

Review title: This Movie Was Not Even Screened For Critics
Review_body: I saw on the trivia that it wasn't screened then when i saw this i realized that THESE GUYS KNOW THEMSELVS THAT THEY ARE HORRIBLE FILM MAKERS they don't even want to be told that there movie is so bad. they just KEEP MAKING MILLIONS. some people don't know a good comedy if it hit them in the face This IS the worst movie i have ever seen IF U LIKE STOLEN JOKES PLEASE SEE IT A lot OF THEM ARE JUST TAKEN FROM OTHER MOVIES 1 out of 10 this movie was WORSE THEN TRASH If anyone wants to ever become a filmmaker or a director these are one of the movies you should watch for inspiration and say to yourself every second u watch "I could make a better movie then this"

This movie is possibly the worst movie i have ever seen, the one thing that still puzzles me is the fact that they ever get picked up by a film house who are willing to make it?????? The fact that the two director/writers have directed 4 movies, 3 of which have been released, and all 3 happen to be in the worst 100 movies ever made within the IMDb. This has a lot to say about their talent or lack of it don't you think? Also this fact doesn't look good for the 4th movie, the up and coming "Disaster Movie" later this year. I predict that this 4th instalment, from these two wannabe's, will meet the same fitting end as the first 3 and end up at around the 70's mark in the worst 100 chart. If you're wondering why I even watched this attempt at comedy, well, the law of averages says that if you do something enough you're bound to get it right eventually. Well, maybe after "Disaster Movie" later this year these guys might do what most normal folk do when they fail so, so often........................ Give up.

I had first watched this movie before watching 300. I had still given it a 5. Today I watched it after watching 300 and I must say, their efforts deserve some appreciation. Ofcourse it's not consistently funny, but some jokes had me in stitches. I would give 7 for the attempt, maybe giving it a 6 for the lack of consistency. Dunno what all the hate is about.

It did contain some pretty childish humor, but that was alright. It also contain a lot of jokes about American Pop Culture and American TV Ads. For me, coming from New Zealand, I didn't get some of those jokes but I still laughed. In the beginning, I wasn't expecting much at all, with the writers coming from doing some pretty pathetic movies. At the start, I was forcing myself to laugh, just because I wanted it to be funny, but then it did something I didn't expect. It actually became funny. What 300 spoof wouldn't be complete with a large amount of gay jokes. This had them all. Even the Fat Guy from Borat. Overall, it was good. Could of been better but its at an acceptable laughter level. Better than any comedy that Ben Stiller has been in. This movie actually makes you laugh. So watch it before you give it a bad rating. I would recommend it.

My best friend and I usually pride ourselves in being rather intelligent. We've seen some very good movies from different genres recently ("Charlie Wilson's War, "P.S. I Love You", and "Atonement"), but this movie left us gasping for air. Sometimes it's nice to let your hair down, put aside intelligent thought for an hour and a half, and enjoy some stupid humor. I'd say that we didn't go more than two minutes without laughing at something. There's a lot of pop culture references, and as long as you don't take it too seriously they're quite funny. If you're easily offended do not go see this movie! However, if you're capable of loosening up and laughing unabashedly at idiotic humor you'll have fun. P.S. If you stay until the very end of the credits there's one last little spoof that's pretty well-placed (considering that it features a character from a movie currently in theatres).

I really don't understand the great deal of dislike for this movie. This movie is full of stupidity, relaxes you, and its short and fun. If you like this type of movies, why not watch this one. I actually had fun, and laughed at many scenes where famous people were made fun off (e.g. Britney Spears). I am not saying that this movie is a master piece, but you should watch it with a little bit more positive attitude and not just the one that many users wrote for you to see, and decide not to watch the movie! The actor Sean Maguire did a very good job, and he is a light of this movie. His relaxed attitude and funny jokes made it very interesting for me... So to sum up, I like the movie, and it's not a waste of time to watch it. I mean why not? Go to little land of stupidity and no problems, and relax, take it easy :)

This is without doubt the worst and gayest movie ever made!!! I give it a star but only because IMDb won't let me rate it less than one star. 0(zero) might be too much for this movie also. Acting awful. Plot line awful. Humor nonexistent (which is rather odd for a parody). I am glad I didn't pay money to see the movie though. That would have been a big mistake. This movie truly sucks. I mean I saw bad movies before, but god damn, this is incredible. A few weeks ago I was searching IMDb trying to find the worst movie ever produced so I could see it out of curiosity. Afterwards I tried finding it on the internet (p2p stuff) and tried downloading but without success. I was just curios to see how bad a movie can suck. Hopefully now I have to look no further, fore I found Meet the Spartans. And this truly is the worst movie ever made!

Review title: This movie isn't even bad enough to let you to laugh at how bad it is.
Review_body: If this is tl;dr (too long; didn't read), just know this: This movie was not entertaining in the least. Do not watch this movie. Not even for free. Do not let your kids see this movie.I knew it was going to be terrible, since all of these movies are. Scary Movie 1 and 2, and maybe 3 were at least mildly funny. I didn't smile even once during Scary Movie 4. Date Movie, I ignored. Epic Movie just made me angry.I had to see how terrible this one was. I figured; "hey, maybe there will be a funny part or two". I was wrong.I couldn't even stomach the whole movie, it was so terrible. I watched this for free on the internet, and shut it off after 20 minutes. I think I got enough of it from the trailers they've been cramming down my throat, though. I actually couldn't watch anymore when they had the Britney Spears thing come on. I had to look away from the screen. Then, shortly after the 10 other people he kicked into the pit, I shut it off. I felt embarrassed to be watching this, even though I was alone.From what I saw, it had no plot, no point, and I counted 20 advertisements in 20 minutes. Something is very wrong here. The jokes were repetitive and overdone. At one point the queen pulls out a laptop (which of course, is a mac) and tells the audience that the movie is a big rip off of 300. Might have been funny if it weren't so expected and done already. It's one thing to parody a few movies. This is just trying to rip off everything it can find.I don't understand how these people can make these movies and get away with so much money! They make a movie that's rated PG-13 with "humour" aimed at 10 year old prepubescent boys that laugh at anything that has to do with farting, private parts, puking, and basically anything inappropriate! I guess they figure if they make a movie crappy enough, and everybody goes to see it once, they will make enough money to profit.That being said, if your kid happens to be throwing a birthday party and is begging for you to rent/buy this movie for him/her, don't. It is very inappropriate and despite its humour being aimed at 10 year-olds, it is not suited for anyone under 16. I didn't watch far enough in to see it, but apparently Carmen Electra is naked except for two tomatoes over her nipples and a slice of pizza over her crotch at some point.People, I implore you: stop it. Stop seeing these movies. Don't even go the first day. Don't go AT ALL. Don't buy the DVD. Don't see them. If every person says "oh I'll just go see it once", they make enough money to keep doing these movies. If anyone cares to look at the time line, they will notice that each movie by these people is worse than the last. They are not going to improve. Just don't see it. If you simply must see these atrocities, wait for someone to put it on the internet, and watch it for free. Don't give these fools anymore money, or else they will continue to make these movies and they will continue to get worse and worse (if it's even possible to get any worse).The only reason this deserves a one out of ten is because it gets the 1 point for being a movie.

Review title: I don't understand why they keep on making movies like this.
Review_body: Some of the popular parodies like Scary movie and its sequels did well. But after that only worse and not even funny parodies came out. Date movie, Epic movie... They keep getting worse. There are so many scenes that I didn't even find funny. At all! They just repeat all the spoofs other parodies make and it just became copying off each other. The plot is completely uninteresting and I forced myself to watch the whole movie because I was about to quit after the first 20 minutes but I just wanted to see how it turned out. Also, I don't understand why actors even accept the role for this movie. This is way out of their league. And as already said, this was a complete waste of my time.

When I went in the see this movie, to be honest, I didn't expect much at all. After seeing how unfunny Epic Movie was, I expected this movie to be the same. Unsurprisingly, I was right, as this movie was nothing more than a bunch of childish unfunny jokes. At the start of the movie, I tried to laugh at the jokes. But as the film progressed, I found myself actually amazed at how this movie didn't go straight to DVD. Sure, I'll give the makers one or two moments that had a slight bit of humor, but all the jokes were extremely dragged on, to the point that I nearly fell asleep in the middle of a "joke". It left me thinking that the film-makers tried way too hard to make people laugh, that they ended up making an unfunny product.I left the cinema feeling ripped off (the first time I had ever felt this about a film). Trying to think of funny parts of the film was hard, as there were not a lot of them. The only reason I would want to see this movie again is for the scenes with Carmen Electra.

I can't believe I wasted time and money to see this crap! I took my son to see this, his choice of course, for his birthday. We all (family of 4) left very disappointed. Please believe me! I was not surprised to see the entire theater get up to leave before the end. If you value your dollar, spend it some other way. If you value your time, spend it somewhere else. I could have taken a nap at home. Besides, a sofa is much more comfortable than theater seats. This is no 'Scary Movie'. Spoof flicks should make you laugh. I groaned though 95% of this garbage.(Correction- 'Hot Garbage.' Ewww! Get the point?) Another thing, who ends a movie like that? What a waste!

Worst film i've seen in a long time. It's sad what it says about us as a culture when drivel like this passes as entertainment. No logic went into writing this.. they just wrote down whatever was on movies or TV at the time. Anyone who rated this 10/10 should have a lobotomy. I feel like less of a human being for having seen this. The directors should probably give up and start directing pornography.. I think it wouldn't be more their forté. This film is an example of how propaganda destroyed the American psyche. Goebbels once said the best way to control the mind of the people is to apply to the lowest common denominator and baseline instinct.. years of this idealism, especially with the Bush Administration, has taken it's toll on the collective conscious of the American public. Quite scary indeed.

The cast and crew they used ware awesome and I liked that movie which is making fun of Spartans (300). The peoples who liked Movie 300, will definitely enjoy this. This is worth watching movie. Don't degrade it... because they just make fun of Spartans Movie 300 (which i like most)... I like that Movie. If you are a movie mania, you'll see how they have added all the famous movies in one and tried to make peoples enjoy. I don' think the rating is correct. In my opinion, the rating should be at least 7. And one more thing, this series they have started is just like Scary Movie... and we should appreciate them in order to produce more movies like that so the peoples can enjoy.

Review title: Hard to claim spoilers when no plot exists.
Review_body: To put it bluntly, I have never seen a worse film. I'll admit, I have been following these releases through the years and have enjoyed most of them. The Scary Movies are all pretty creative, I think, and do make me laugh. The spin-offs are less abundant in imagination, but still are enjoyable. But this... I just wasn't feeling it. Like a previous commenter said, a certain joke can only be told so many times. Yeah, I get that these people are gay. While it may be funny a first or second time, it gets old fast. There were a few times where I felt like leaving the theater for this very reason.Also, it doesn't help that it attempts to capitalize and embody the worst shows modern television has to offer. If you are a person who can't stand watching: American Idol, MTV's Yo Mamma(real title?), that Deal or No Deal show, or Dancing With the Stars... you will be infuriated by this film.Very rarely do I find myself staring at the credits after a movie, feeling so ripped off.

Review title: About as funny and entertaining as anal rape.
Review_body: This was possibly one of the worst movies I have ever seen. That is no exaggeration. This movie is absolute SH*T. I watched it for free two days ago, and I'm still p*ssed about the fact that I payed for the electricity I wasted to power my television. I felt like RIPPING MY F*CKING EYES OUTI HAVE HAD TEETH PULLED THAT WERE MORE ENJOYABLE THAN THISTHERE HAVE BEEN GENOCIDES FUNNIER THAN THISOH GOD THE HUMANITYWhy in the good lord's name would anyone seek to produce a cinema representation of horse sh*t is far beyond my knowledge. This movie is the definition of cr*p. Actually, I just took a dump an hour ago, and it was funnier than this movie.I would rather use the DVD to slice my d*ck off than watch this atrocious monstrosity of a film.

IN A NUTSHELL the movie was the biggest waste of $3.99 at Blockbuster I've ever seen. I've seen low budget movies from the '70's that were better than Meet The Spartans.::::::::I really like the Scary movies, Epic Movie, and above all I loved Date movie. I think those movies contained tasteful parodies, even as raunchy as they were.But 300 was an awesome movie. And it was a pitiful attempt to spoof it. WARNING: SPOILERS:The jokes they tried to make on it were tasteless with no humor. The Yo Mama jokes and the dance competition that were supposed to take the place of the battle itself.... that was a DAMN epic battle, and comparing it to dance and Yo Mama jokes???, just stupid. Not funny at all.I did think it was funny with the guy who played in the Hercules series (I don't know his name) was there, I thought that kind of made sense. But all the gay jokes. Not so funny.And Carmen Electra turning into Spiderman and then Traitoriou....blah, whatever the hell his name was, turning into the sand thing villain. Again. Stupid.The whole blue screen thing. Stupid. The Borat guy playing Xerxes. Stupid. Paris Hilton as the Quasimoto looking thing. Stupid. I wasn't even a good look a like. Instead she looked like that blonde girl from The Suite Life of Zack and Cody and High School Musical. The fat Spartan. Stupid.It was all just stupid. You can't make fun of something so damn AWESOME. You just can't.

Review title: Probably the worst movie I have seen in years.
Review_body: First fifteen minutes were somewhat slapstick and moved right along. Had quite a few laughs, my kids especially thought the initial part was funny. What followed was a lot of tedium, punctuated with the obligatory Carmen Electra slow-mo dancing. Unfortunately, the PG-13 keeps them from showing any of Carmen's fine body in the nude. That MIGHT have made me feel like I got some of my money's worth.What drug the movie down also was the tendency to flog any joke to death,especially the Britney spears bit. Basically, you could watch the commercials about 10 times in a row, and that is it. They also had a couple of gags that centered around a blue screen, they beat that one at least three times. They tried in vain to find something funny about the movie three hundred, but let's face it. 300 was almost too serious and action oriented to be spoofed in a sophomoric PG-13 flick.Yeah, they attempted weakly to skewer popular culture, which only means that this movie will have lost all relevancy in about 5 years when the next generation forgets or loses caring over ripping Britney Spears and her pop-culture female counterparts. The bits where they rip Lindsay Lohan and Paris Hilton were not so much mean spirited as they were weak and desperate attempts at capitalizing on media frenzy. I am pretty much ambivalent about the suffering caused celebrities by parody. I would bet however that Lohan, Spears and Hilton felt not so much skewered by the rapier wit of a comedic genius, as hammered with the blunt tool of a script that appeared to be pounded out by middle schoolers.I don't think that celebs really mind being parodied when there is some real thought and humor behind it, but this clumsy fair was no more than an awful, embarrassing and ham-fisted bit of half-assed character assassination. All the meanness and none of the cleverness.It's been a long time since I have considered asking for my money back, but I would not have wasted another minute on this movie even getting a refund. The time I spent in the theater was a chunk of my life that can never be recovered. This is one of those flicks where if you have seen the commercial, you have seen the highlights already. IF you really want the best of this bore, wait for it to show up on cable (give it 6 months at best) and watch only the first 20 minutes.Save the rest of the time for re-sorting your sock drawer. You'll thank me later, trust me.

Imagine getting raped by a rabid unicorn. What sort of pain would you feel as his rainbow releases struck your insides, turning your intestines to candy? How about shoving a pineapple up your rear? It seems painful to me. Despite this fact, I would rather have one of those, or many other tortures exacted upon me than be forced to watch this movie again. I guarantee you, go to any elementary school in the world, find their dumbest student (the kid who is in the corner covering his body in feathers and pom poms), and ask him about his bodily functions in detail. Whatever he says, no matter how inane, would make a funnier movie than this atrocity. As would babies getting cooked on an open stove. And handicapped people falling down elevator shafts. If you value your life, please, I implore you, burn whatever copy of this movie you see.
Horrible movie. Filled with descusting sceenes of vomit and mucis every few minutes, with horrible so called jokes is not worth the time of even a dead man

i can't even believe this movie happened. i knew it would be rude and stupid from the start, but i figured i could handle it. five minutes into the movie i had decided that enough was enough.the movie (or what i saw of it) was grotesque, offensive, tacky, and most of all NOT FUNNY! i couldn't believe my eyes and ears when the penguin told Leonidas to lick his balls. who would allow their name to be put on such disgusting material? anyway, i would never ever recommend anyone see this movie. ever. it has to be the worst spoof i've ever seen (and i thought Date Movie was bad). what happened to the days of censorship?? at least then we knew crap like this wouldn't happen.DO NOT SEE THIS MOVIE.

Review title: Excellent movie, very very funny and great acting!
Review_body: This movie is genius and very funny. Great actors and well written. The previous comment almost made me give this movie a miss. I am glad I ignored his untruthful and spiteful review. Disregard his comments and take the family to see this and split your sides. In fact I enjoyed it so much I will definitely buy the DVD when it comes out as I would like to watch it again.It it is a comedy sketch of 300 and is hilarious. The actors are very good for unknowns and the special effects are brilliant.Its a shame people are so sad and mean that they lie about things just to spoil other peoples work efforts and other peoples fun.If you enjoyed 300 you will enjoy this too!

Review title: The absolute worst of film making, and dare i say it, human behaviour
Review_body: Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer. Never have i despised 2 individuals such as the discontent i have for both these unimaginative, humourless so called creative minds. How they continue to make movies is beyond me. They have just completed a hat trick with Meet The Spartans, that is, created 3 of the worst movies ever seen in a row. It's an incredible feat. Despite having a free ticket and being begged to attend with a friend (i have closed and terminated that friendship as a result), i still felt ripped off. Actually scrap that, i felt physically abused after viewing this. Stripped of any dignity.And despite this, we still see users on IMDb that actually give this rating more than 1 star (I'd happily hack the website and change the code to allow a zero rating if i could). I'm not sure as to what the mindset is of a person that could find this utter drivel humorous. Perhaps they find the idea of referencing a movie without actually making it any funnier, or on occasions, actually changing the script as a comedic tool. If that fails, let's use gay jokes. If that fails, lets reference again and this time tell the audience what it is we are referencing just in case they didn't laugh the first time. I mean the lack of humour is quite staggering, it actually made me cringe. I think heard more laughs in the cinema whilst watching Requiem For A Dream.I mean to call this movie a spoof is a complete and utter insult to the likes of Airplane! and Spaceballs. In fact, its an insult to the country of America that such a movie could be released. The fact that it made something like $18 million in its opening week perhaps give us an insight as to why America is the focus of terrorism. Perhaps these sources of terror were exposed to the films of Jason Friedberg & Aaron Seltzer.

Review title: Funny movie that needs a little bit more...
Review_body: When I first saw the trailer, i thought it was going to be better than Epic and Date Movie...but apparently, i was wrong. It was just at the same level as Epic Movie. (better than Date Movie though...) I enjoyed the scenes where they spoof reality shows (ANTM, American Idol..etc..) and i thought the scene with Tyra would be funnier if they had her do the melt down again.. (rmb the Tiffany season?) and i was hoping they spoof Project Runway. I also enjoyed Nicole Parker in the movie. She did a great job spoofing Paris, Britney and Paula. I didn't like the ending, where all of them sang "I'll Survive" because it just seemed as if they couldn't make any more stuff up...and they had to add in one of those scenes with some credits.(It was pretty lame..) Plus, when the credits started rolling, i left because i thought it ended...BUT! more scenes came up! So, it was really a waste to put those scenes 2 mins after the credits began rolling...it could have added more fun to the actual movie. Overall, this movie was OK but i would suggest you to wait until it comes out on DVD and then go rent it.

Review title: Worth seeing for anyone without a stick shoved up their ass...
Review_body: Although this movie does have negative reviews, I'd like to point out that those select reviewers most certainly have a something shoved up their ass. For one, anyone who is going to see this movie should know from the previews, and simply from the name of the film, that this is a parody movie. If you strenuously hate the Date movies, Scary movies or the Epic Movie then what are you doing watching this film? 'Meet The Spartans' is a film that is obviously marketed towards teenagers, and it delivers well to this said group. I actually watched this movie twice, both times the cinema was packed with teens, and everyone was laughing throughout the movie. Memorable scenes, ranging from clever 'Yo Mama' jokes to Britney Spears (She is a joke, yes?) do make this movie worthwhile. There is no great cinematography in the film, but that's hardly expected. All in all, I believe this is a good movie to see if you're looking for a laugh-- it's something you would see with friends for a good time out.

Review title: Why do these two think they can wirte funny movies?
Review_body: i have always loved the scary movie stuff because they spoofed scary movies and such. But these two have got to be the WROST movie writers ever. I mean the fact that Hollywood would let them write another movie like this is a poor choice on there part.at least this had some sort of plot i mean epic movie had no plot just crappy jokes and date movie was god awful but this movie had some sort of plot it had some plot of 300.but the problem with these movies is that they only spoof current events and Hollywood and not as much movies. i mean in 10 years or so teenagers are gonna have no clue as to what the heck they are talking about.now that these writers have made 3 crappy movies they should NOT be allowed to make movies anymore.if you agreed this movie sucked post here

Review title: what a waste of my time...
Review_body: This movie was not only a waste of money, it was horribly short and not even remotely funny.I saw this this afternoon with two kids who were absolutely amped to see it, and by halfway through the movie (these are 12 year olds we're talking about) they were bored out of their minds.The rip-offs of Paris hilton, Britney spears, American idol, America's next top model, dancing with the stars, happy feet, the apprentice, you got served, spiderman 3, stomp the yard, 300 (duh), shrek, lindsay lohan, amongst the other so called "stars" wasn't even remotely funny.I'll give you a hint: don't waste your time with this movie.

Going into Meet the Spartans, I did not fully expect a 300 spoof to last the entire length of the film. Needless to say, it did. While the film did have some laughs, I will give it that, I was a little taken aback at the overwhelming level of gay jokes, vomit/assorted spew gags, fart jokes, and gratuitous Carmen Electra body shots. Perhaps if you are in the age range 12-17 (or maybe beyond) you may find this movie funny. Personally, I found parts of this movie funny, but as a whole, I felt like I had been ripped off when I left the theater. It was short, but maybe in this case this is actually a positive thing, because after much longer, I'm not sure if I would have been able to remain in my seat.Age: 19 Gender: male Tastes: usually will enjoy the occasional fart/sex/etc joke, but in this case, maybe this movie crossed the line a little.In conclusion, if Epic Movie is in your top ten, you will probably love this movie.

After spending £7 to view this utter crap it would appear i spent more on my cinema ticket than the film company did on actually making the film. When writing a review i usually include both good and bad aspects of the film however their are no good aspects to this film. The jokes were predictable and in bad taste. The acting was poor to say the least and overall it was simply a dreadful film. I struggled to understand who would actually like this film, no one who possesses an IQ could possibly have found it entertaining. I feel sorry for anyone else that had to watch this and warn anyone who is planning to.The only good thing about the film was the ending...because then it was over.

Pretty much, I had high hopes for this movie, seeing the previews over and over and over earlier in the year. Just a while ago, I actually rented it, and it was complete garbage! There was barely any movies referenced, with the exception of 300, Transformers and if I'm right, that's all! It was mostly Game Shows (American Idol, Deal or No Deal, Yo Momma) and HORRIBLE HORRIBBLE impressions. Not to mention that half of the previews they showed on TV were deleted scenes during the END CREDITS. WHO DOES THAT??? I want my dollar back. Yea, that's right, I paid a dollar for renting that movie, and I want it back!! All of the scenes that were supposed to be funny were ruined by Kevin Sorbo. Where's he been all this time? Most of the cast was either newer actors, or a bunch of washed up has-beens. Deidrich Bader and Carmen Electra? She must have been desperate for movie roles. She's taking everything that flies her way!! Date Movie, Meet the Spartans, Scary Movie, Scary Movie 4, and pretty much any spoof/parody script, she's doing. Now that I guess her relationship with Dave Navarro is done and over with, she's not famous anymore.

Review title: This Movie Wasn't What I Was Hoping For
Review_body: I love funny movies. The Scary Movie series was really good. Epic Movie also had a high rating on my part. Tonight Me and my friends (we are 14) went to see Meet The Spartans. All I can say is, we had more fun laughing at each other than the movie. There was no story line to it at all. It was filled with advertisements from companies like Coke and Gatorade. There were a couple funny parts but not enough to keep you focused. Not enough parodies. We read tons of reviews online and all of them had low ratings but we didn't believe them. We thought they just didn't have a sense of humor. We were wrong, this movie didn't have a sense of humor. Lots of scenes in the trailer are not in the movie. When the movie started there was only about 20 other people in the theater. When the credits started at the end. At the most 10 were left.So no, PLEASE believe me.
