Take this from a 14 year old guy who laughs at everything, don't waste your money on this. Go see something better like Cloverfield.

Review title: An okay parody, i cant see why this movie is hated by so many
Review_body: I wasn't expecting a lot from this movie because of all the bad reviews, but my sister liked so I watched it hoping to get few laughs. That's exactly what I got, couple of good laughs and some fun while watching this. The acting, writing and directing is pretty much what I expect from this kind of parody, not great, but does the job. The jokes were easy to spot, so you probably wont miss a thing even if you take a bathroom break and leave the movie running. A lot of the jokes were on the media, commercials and off-course modern movies, mainly 300. In the end, this is an okay movie, and if you liked epic movie and scary movies you will find this worth watching. If you don't like that kind of movies, do not watch this.

Review title: An hour an a half of gay jokes isn't funny
Review_body: I went into this movie with low expectations, which proved to be correct in my opinion. How useless are the writers who thought up this movie? After creating Date Movie and Epic movie I would have though they would give up but instead they created this sorry excuse for a movie which is blatantly a waste of 90 minutes.After running out of ideas of how to mock Britany Spears, Paris Hilton and other Hollywood celebrates this movie just became one gay joke after another. There were rarely any bright moments in this film as the humor became more and more demented as the film continued. Don't get me wrong I can take joke and enjoyed most of the Scary Movie series but Meet The Spartans was terrible. This is definitely the worst comedy I have ever seen in my entire life. PLEASE FOR YOUR OWN SAKE DO NOT WATCH THIS FILM. YOU WILL BE Disappointed (and if you are not you must have the maturity of an eight year old).

Review title: Simply The WOrst Movie Ever Made In the History Of the World
Review_body: One Of The Worst Movies In History. I recently Thought Ue Bowell Made Horrible GArbarge But The Directors who made this movie take the cake.spoofing such movies and video games and Pop Cilture such as SPiderman 3, 300, Grand theft Auto, Chris Crocker, Transformers.The Jokes are Very Very Outdated, Avoid This MOvie at All Costs. IF you wanna Catch this movie Then watch it online. don't pay for it. you will be disappointed. usually ill laugh at pretty much anything but this movie was dull and boring and just stupid. please just don't watch it.The Writing to this Movie Blows. And Why The Hell Is CArmen Electra In this MOvie. She Just CAnt Act. And Whats the Deal with Kevin Sorbo oh yes did i mention Kevin sorbo is in this movie. remember him from the Hercules TV show. well yes he is in this movie. and he is sucking it hard. no pun intended.

it was OK... some bits were funny but the beginning with the pit was OK but dragged out for too long to the point were it got embarrassing! watched the first 3 minuets and thought oh no i have to sit 2 hours of this! the story line was pretty pointless and the fact they all died in the end anyway was a bit of a let down!.. there were some good parts though n some very funny references and i love the fact they completely slaughtered Paris Hilton and Britney! for people who are expecting to go see an amazing spoof film like dawn of the dead of hot fuzz I'm sad to say you're going to be bitterly disappointed! 1 wouldn't go out and rush n watch it again! .. OK n did make me laugh a bit but not the greatest spoof in the world....

Review title: Good movie if you want to laugh.
Review_body: This was a great movie, especially the beginning. Maybe it's because I'm 17, maybe I find more things funny. I thought that, for the most part it was funny, so did the rest of the audience. Unlike Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans actually follows the story of 300 from start to finish with spoofs and parodies mixed in. Some parts of the movie however seem like they were added because they had nothing else to put there. An example of that would be the part with Carmen Electra in a spider man suit hanging from the building. All in all, this movie is a good movie if you want a laugh, but it's the kind of movie you have to have friends with to watch, otherwise it's not that funny. Also, may not be funny to all ages.

There are movies which have some kind of value in them. This movie is just NOT one of these. I understand that they wanted to create a funny spoof movie from a low budget but they totally failed. The whole movie is like 1 hour long, full of mind-killing, pathetic flicks which made me think they made it this bad on purpose. To tell you the truth, I couldn't finish it because it was getting more and more annoying and I couldn't stand it.I wanted to rate this film to 0 / 10 or even -1 / 10 but it's not possible so I had to give it 1/10 (awful)...If you don't want to cry on pathetic jokes, avoid this film.

Review title: Spoof on 300 with a bunch of Hot Shots / Mel Brooks gags.
Review_body: What's wrong with everyone giving this movie 2,5. Now i know I should probably dig through other <5 rated comedies, seeing this pearl has gotten such a low score.First of all, don't look for plot. It's there, it just doesn't care. Subtlety? Fuhgeddaboutit. The whole movie is like Mel Brooks on steroids. And don't say that this is hardly worthy of comparison with Mel Brooks. It's all the same humour, just that you were younger when you watched Mel Brooks and it was funnier then. OK maybe the plot is something Mel Brooks movies' do have, but the jokes are similar - completely absurd and arbitrary references, anachrony, bizarre jokes and a bit of slapstick humour. It's supposed to be corny. You're supposed to be used to that.Second of all, it's a parody. A good ol' 80's style parody. Which means that some of the spoofs will just be an exaggeration of actual scenes from the original. No punchline. No meta-joke. Just a funny guy who speaks in an 'epic' accent who gets in a battle of wits (yo momma jokes) with Xerxes' RUN-DMC shirted crew. Stuff like that. Anyway, the acting is bad, the montage is frantic, storyline vague.. But that was never the point. It's gag after gag after gag. You'll see all pop culture and modern references you can imagine, which will completely set you off from the "original plot". Yeah right.Just think of the 80s, and remember your first impression of Hot Shots 2. This was even better.

Review title: Why can't it be given a 0?
Review_body: IMDb gets better and better everyday. Not only are movies listed, there are also TV shows, and now they even list Meet The Spartans. Meet The Spartans isn't a movie, you see. This piece of film actually is quite revolting. It leaves you wondering who the target audience might be: some jokes are pretty gross, to the point no non-adult audience should be able to watch it. The remainder of the jokes aren't funny, so no able minded adult individuals would possibly find entertainment in them.Meet The Spartans has two types of jokes: 1) Gross-out, non funny jokes; and 2) non-gross-out jokes, which are just as unfunny. Even by the standards set by recent Fox spoof movies, this fails epically. I could not honestly tell you 1 joke which made anyone laugh at the theater I was in. It was confusing. It was gross. It was revolting. But funny, it was not.The production level of this..... thing..... is absolutely non-existent. The most anti-funny parts of the movie are actually the longest. The dance sketch which you see for about 5 seconds in the ads actually lasts a good 5-7 minutes. The song at the end lasts about another 5 minutes. A 'yo-momma' jokes battle is also in the movie, and they manage to somehow get that wrong, with the 'yo-momma' jokes being some of the most unfunny 'yo-momma' jokes I have ever heard. I could honestly come up with funnier versions of this joke on the spot. This movie has cheap written all over it, which would be OK if any comedy was to be found within.Do yourself a favor and don't go watch this. No, not even if you just read this review and said to yourself "wow, how terrible could it possibly be? I must watch it!" Stop yourself from going to the theaters, and thank me later for saving 65 minutes (that's when I left the movie, when the credits started rolling) of your life that you would otherwise never get back.

I didn't watch past the first 10 minutes of this. It was so lame and contrived I was cringing at each "joke". I kept hoping it would get better or funnier or more creative or something! I actually feel like kind of physically sick and also a little bit dumber it was so amazingly bad. I would actually rather watch something like Jerry Springer because it has more intelligence than this. And I really hate Jerry Springer. It almost seems like a joke that it was so terrible. I cant imagine the writers of this film or the actors having any kind of pride in it. It had about all the plot quality and acting skill as a porno. As a matter of fact it might have been better if it had been written as one, because then there would be some distractions.

I don't know how my brain allowed me to see this picture. I thought it would be like trying to suffocate yourself; your body would just shut down before you could do it. Apparently I was wrong. I sat through this movie and laughed once, and that was during the preview for another movie. There was the odd part where I might have cracked a smile or thought, "This might be funny if..." but there is a very good reason for that. Instead of making good jokes and thoughtful humour, the writers decided to just constantly send an endless stream of jokes at you and hoped one of them made you chuckle. This movie was truly atrocious. You would think after having their last two films be on the bottom 100 of this site, the makers would say, "Lets try something different," but no, it is the exact same as Date Movie and Epic Movie; Bad.

This was literally the worst movie I have ever seen. I am a movie buff and tend to love all sorts of movies, this movie was a waste of my time and money. They tend to use the same joke time and time again, after the first time, it's not funny anymore!! Also, Parents beware!! This is NOT a movie for children to go to. It is PG-13 but I feel anyone under 16 should not see it, in one scene Carmen Electra is laying on a table with only tomatoes covering her nipples and a slice of pizza covering her crotch. There are lots of other provocative scenes that is inappropriate for children. All in all the movie was crude, disgusting and vulgar, not funny at all except for the opening scene. Don't see it, you'll be extremely disappointed.

Review title: Thank heaven Will Ferrell wasn't in it because it's a really hilarious spoof!
Review_body: ..This is the movie Mad Comics will have wished it made! ancient history mixed with 2007 current events and celebrity happenings. All the fallen idols are skewered from Brittney and Kevin, Nicole,Paris, Lohan. All this happening while a complete satire of the "300" is reworked.Sorbo and McQuire are excellent as is the Xerxes dude from Borat.Carman Electra has finally found a genre where her over-the-top performances and boobs work. The pop culture American Idol and Dancing with the Stars fit easily into this production. The dancing was humorous and the finale was mind boogling. One of the memorable scenes was the Persian ballet as they catapulted off the cliff. Great anxiety-elimination movie. Something for everyone, including the homophobic, ha ha.

showing Xerxes like this its nothing except dishonor to Persian culture. Xerxes was son of Darius the Great of Persia and Atossa, the daughter of Cyrus the Great. After his accession in October 485 BC, he suppressed the revolts in Egypt and Babylon that had broken out the year before and appointed his brother Achaemenes as governor or satrap over Egypt (Old Persian: khshathrapavan). In 484 BC, he took away from Babylon the golden statue of Bel (Marduk, Merodach), the hands of which the legitimate king of Babylon had to seize on the first day of each year, and killed the priest who tried to hinder him. Therefore Xerxes does not bear the title of King in the Babylonian documents dated from his reign, but King of Persia and Media or simply King of countries (i.e. of the world). This proceeding led to two rebellions, probably in 484 BC and 479 BC. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xerxes_I_of_Persia

This is arguably one of the most well executed films out there. The timing of the comical aspects matched superbly with the delicately placed visual-audio effects. The cinematic atmosphere provided an elegant, yet intentionally brusque plot that frankly served as a nice complement to the pop culture genre. The inner child that is inherent within all Spartans was a clear example of this, not to mention the lovable Father-Son relationship as exemplified at the beginning of the sequence.I would highly recommend seeing this movie as soon as possible. You don't want to miss out.

I thought at times the movie was funny and the actors matched their characters well but felt as though it copied (a bit too much) other movies such as Monty Python, Men in Tights and scary movie, for example. Sometimes this humor gets a little old in other movies. I also thought that the movie was too short. There were 20 minutes of previews and roughly an hour of actual movie. It should have been longer and more creative. I had such high expectations from the previews but after about half way through the movie, it was difficult to give praise to the attempted humor. It wasn't worth paying $7!! I was disappointed! I gave the movie a 3 because I laughed at times.

I realize that spoof movies are all about corny jokes and playing off the themes of popular culture, but it should hopefully say something that I registered a profile just to comment on how unbelievably awful this movie was. Just in the hopes that someone else doesn't waste their time on this piece of garbage.The jokes pander to the lowest common denominator, and don't even accomplish that right. There is absolutely no cleverness, the jokes are the most obvious and aren't even funny when executed.Even though the movie in only an hour long, it felt like 2 or 3. It's just a series of one bad joke after another, and it stays pretty much as a spoof of 300, which didn't exactly have a lot of story to mock to begin with.I wish I hadn't seen this movie. I wish I hadn't paid for this movie. I wish I didn't feel bad when people I know found out that I saw this movie and paid to do it in a theater.

Review title: Not as bad as Epic movie but c'mon guys you can do better
Review_body: I naively really wanted to see this movie, and against my better judgment I really went. The movie was full of obvious attempts at humor that I would have found funny maybe if I was 6 years old and like bad sexual humor. It was worse than what MADTV has become. This is a sorry excuse for a movie. My thoughts summed up: -Very bad fart and sex jokes -none of them are even close to funny -movie had SOO much potential but the writers and director need to grow up. -Cheap humor, anytime you might think "oh it would be so funny if..." Bam joke killed be an early punchline that is not funny. I got no laughs out of this movie.Go put peanut butter on the roof of your dog's mouth watch for 5 minutes. Repeat. Repeat.

I rate this movie as 3 out of 10, to appeal ordinary audience. However, I have got this feeling that the writers of these series (scary movie, date movie, epic movie and meet the Spartans) are extremely successful. It's true that they have produced absolutely the most money-wasting times in cinema, however, I HAVE WATCHED THEM ALL! yes, they are cheap laughs. but if they make another similar film in the future, i can tell that deep in your mind you will have a slice of curiosity (with extra bit of push)that might get you to sit in front of the screen again.most directors aim to make films like godfather or shaw-shank or matrix. they are artistic in that way. however, cheap laughs are also a form of behaviour art.

i don't agree ,this film is very funny , maybe it is cheap or something else , i don't matter , because there a lot of episodes you can laugh , i think the producers to hit the nail on the head sneering of current affairs ( like Britney shaving her head and showing her crotch, the same from Paris Hilton , Lindsay drugs and etc )! i vote 10 ! i had a good time ! Carmen Electra was acting very cool :) the best episode was then was shown the guy or girl(i don't no what it is ) crying for Britney : " leave Britney alone , she is a human " :DD and very funny was kicking everybody in the black hole :)the guy Ken D was cool too :) i think people should see this movie. so I'm waiting for next movies of Jason F. and Aaron Seltzer . i wish you good ideas and more movies like this

This movie was the most stupidest and inappropriate movie ever!!!!! It was just so nasty for a spoof movie. If I could picked the worst spoof movie, or even any movie, it would would be this nasty movie!!!!!!!!!!!!! There were some funny parts in it, but still it had some non-funny parts. If I could change it,(and I would absolutely would), I would take out the every single inappropriate part, and replace them with a little less inappropriate parts. Sure some of the weird parts were funny, but not all of them. But I did like the plot of the movie, just not what was in it. If someone just wants to see the movie for fun, I would not recommend this movie to anyone under the age of 10 or 11. If I could rate this for plot, it would be a 4 or 5, but for actions of the actors, would be a -10.

Review title: very VERY funny film, i was laughing my head off
Review_body: This is far by the funniest film i have ever seen. I cant believe how funny it was. I also cant believe all you other people don't think that this film is funny. you lot obviously have no sense of humour and you don't know what a funny film is. I just hope they make more films like this, i also wish that everyone else liked this film. I give this film 10 stars not like your 1-2 stars, why don't u like it, can any of you give a good enough reason not to like it? because i can give you loads to love it, i wonder if they will make any more films like this one. Is this film like epic movie because it has a reference to epic movie in it, i just love the part that is so funny.

this group of movies is getting worse and worse, scary movie was decent, Spartans was horrible. my little brother cried until i agreed to go with him, i sat through this masterpiece wondering how they keep getting the funding to make more of these!! after i was tricked into going to epic movie by their deceivingly entertaining commercials, i vowed to never see another movie from the series, but i was forced to go, i had low expectations going in and even i was surprised by how bad it was, i was actually ANGRY!!! the only parts i liked were the ones where Carmen Electra was dancing or lying around nearly naked ha ha, so if that's all you're looking for, then you might like thins, but if you go to movies to actually be entertained and not be ashamed to mention that you went to it, this is definitely not for you. as for me, i am going to forget i ever went to this piece of crap and never tell anyone!!!

This movie was excellent! I strongly suggest to see it. The content wasn't that bad, it was just very funny. Even if you like what they are making fun of, it is still hilarious. I liked almost everything they made fun of but i still loved the movie. I am so going to buy it when it comes out on DVD. So if your looking to see a movie this one is great! The movie is only rated p g 13 and there is mostly just crude humor, but even at that its not bad. All you really pay attention to is the comedy in it. Im thinking about taking a lot of my friends to see it, i think they would like it. If you like movies like scary movie 1, 2, 3, and 4, or epic movie, you would definitely enjoy this movie, everyone I know that saw it liked it a lot! It is a great movie!

Even posting a review is a waste of time for a movie that bad... It's hard to write ten lines about something that stupid.. Well then:The pathetic part is that they still find actors doing those movies. Do they actually get paid for that or do they read the script if there was one? I mean, I was going to ask for a refund on my way out. I normally don't complain about movies because at the end it's my decision to see them this one you shouldn't even call a movie. Just do yourself a favor and don't watch it!!!WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY!!!Enough said!

What a god d**e piece of s**t. Really this bulls**t was the worst "thing" because movie would be a too good title for that awful s**t. (Excuse this word but really) the worst movie ever seen please everyone who didn't see it and think well it couldn't be so bad...believe me it is. Okay to be fair: ONE POINT and I mean only ONE POINT for the first scene with Paris Hilton I had to smile when she came into the scene but the rest...bad jokes bad allusives...I have just waste another hour of my time with this and I'm very glad that it was just one hour. Review title: Don't waste an hour of your life watching this.
Review_body: I went to go see this with a few friends just to distract me from the amount of stress I have had this week. It was either this movie or Jumper, and my friends and I decided what the heck lets just go and see this.What a mistake. I should have been at home doing homework. It would of been far more exciting.It was dreadful. If you have seen the trailer, that basically sums up all the whole movie (if you want to call it that) in 30 seconds. The jokes where lame and repeated over and over, it was fake and the acting was pathetic. IT WAS THE WORST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. It's as though someone off the street with no imagination whatsoever said to themselves "Hey! what the heck I'll make a crappy rip off of 300!" My movie ticket said it went for at least an hour and half, but it went for about half of that. I sat in the cinema waiting for the bloody thing to get to the point, but it never did. It had no story whatsoever and the jokes where, well, non-existent.I want to walk out of the cinema with a good feeling and "money well spent" attitude, but this movie made me go up to the counter and ask for my money back. I felt like crying...I wasted 11 dollars and and an hour of my life on this..."movie."I didn't even want to rate this....it doesn't deserve even the thought of a rating. Do not see this movie even if you liked scary movie and epic movie. It made me sick, and your sure to be disappointed too.

Review title: ~~*Meet the Spartans Is NOT worth seeing at the cinemas!*~~
Review_body: Meet the Spartans is a HUGE rip off of 300 and a stupid idiotic film! Most of the so called "Humorous scenes" were really not funny at all, the start was okay but when the movie really gets into the story you realize it was a waste of money. Some of the scenes were disturbing and made me feel sick. One scene was especially annoying was the Pit of Death, I completely over the whole Pit of Death scene, the first time someone got thrown in I thought it was sort of funny then it seemed like everyone was getting thrown in and it became very annoying. I would not recommend watching this movie at the cinemas, it is a complete waste of time and money! For those who would like to see it, maybe borrow it from Videoezy or something when it is released because it's not worth buying on DVD. In this movie there is a lot of sexual scenes, and probably wouldn't be suitable for under 13's to see this movie.

Review title: I think the director has fallen on his head the day before they started filming
Review_body: This movie is the worst movie I have ever seen. it is a cheap fake ass comedy there is nothing funny in it and DOINT WASTE YOUR MONEY. just give it to a homeless guy or junkie. the only thing funny in the movie was. let me think NOTHING. i think the director has fallen from the stairs the day before or he was stoned, drunk, he wasn't sober. boycott the movie. the f word for the movie and the director and cast just everybody who worked on it respect for Mothedman Wu tang you deserve better. and this movie made 50 mil i doint know how but they did it i can't get it something has to be funny in the movie but i don't know what. you could see my teeth only when Britney shaved her head bolt.

I certainly would not pay to see this film. Defiantly not the worst film I've seen, but it's in the category of (I've seen it, won't watch it again). It is much like There's Something About Mary - Great for the first 10 minutes and for the rest... well I could have been cleaning my toilet for all the enjoyment I got out of it.If you like slap-stick and explained humour then watch it, its for you. If you like your irony a little more subtle - AVOID! Must admit, I did enjoy seeing all those unsavory characters flung into the pit of death, that's why it got a 3 instead of a 2. Good to see Sean Maguire on screen again, haven't seen him since Grange Hill. Shame it was in this film.

Well, I think the movie was good. Of course its a parody on some other movies, but if you like other parody movies like "Scary Movie", you'll probably like it too. I can ignore the fact that the movie was made on low budget, and some scenes and locations are made simple and cheap because of it. You can't expect every movie to be a Hollywood-blockbuster production. This movie makes even fun of those digital-enhanced films. The storyline is pretty simple and follows the events of the film "300". After seeing "Meet The Spartans", I think they made some scenes even better (and funnier too) then the original scenes from "300". So if you don't mind low budget films and like parody, you should watch this one.

Review title: Twisted humor will crack you up
Review_body: This movie made me laugh so hard I had to stand up, I do not understand how this movie could get such a low rating, I guess we are just very few people on this site that share this sense of humor. You would, like the other movies produced by the same people, need to have seen the movies they are making fun with, in order to find this movie even more funny. This movie is like one big laugh, you can barely catch your breath before the next thing crack you up, you would have to be extremely dull if you do not find this movie the slightest big funny. This twisted form of humor is just so great, and the way things happen in the movie is truly epic, you constantly get surprised of the makers ways of introducing stuff, you just sit back laugh and wonder how the hell did they come up with stuff like that. If you are sort of a movie geek, and have good humor, this is one of the funniest movies you can watch these days.

I also think that the film was shortened.After watching the trailers there were many funny parts, like- Donnald Trump was supposed to appear but never did? and in the credits there were many look-a-likes mentioned that we never saw. The film also seemed very short and was disappointed with the parts they had cut out. The directors are from the Scary Movie series, but this film seems weak, compared to the humour in the Scary Movies. I think the directors were trying to make it open for more audiences by making it a 12a. Overall, the film was funny from beginning to end, but very low budgeted.Hopefully when the DVD is realised it will come with the missed out features that were not included in the movie.

Meet the Spartans was released in 2008, and offered the same kind of spoof that Epic Movie made, which was made in 2007. Both of these movies made fun of celebrities and other movies released a year or two before they had the chance to show it on the big screen. For example, Meet the Spartans was released in 2008, but made fun of the movie 300, which was released in 2007. Both Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans are awful movies, and only feature a couple moments of laughter,(if any) and small cracks. Meet the Spartans is also filled with completely random scenes in a hope to make you laugh. As if the random scenes aren't enough, the credits also show small clips of the movie that wasn't seen in the beginning, and they are just as random and unfunny as the other scenes in the movie. Almost every joke in the movie, is either refferenced to pop culture, or some kind of sick, dirty joke. With a terrible story line,annoying jokes and humor, the only thing that you'll be laughing at when watching Meet the Spartans is at yourself, for realizing that you have wasted about $10 to see a movie that completely wastes your time, and doesn't make you laugh at the same time. The only people who will be laughing at this kind of humor, are usually young audiences. (pre-teens to teens) It is unfortunate to see movies like Date Movie, Epic Movie and Meet the Spartans, are wasting everybody's time and money, and even if any of these movies were to go on DVD for a dollar, it wouldn't even be a good buy, and the movies are even more worthless than 1 dollar. Also keep in mind that Jason Friedberd, and Aaron Seltzer are the ones behind this catastrophe.

I really wanted this to be funny. Yet with zero laughs this movie ended up making me hate it by bringing down 300 which is a super bad-ass movie. If you watch the trailer you will get the most laughs possible from this movie. Even the laughs in the trailer are ruined by the garbage that actually surrounds it in the actual movie. If this movie were 30 seconds long i would have given it a 10. How can you ruin a scene where brittany spears is kicked into a bottomless pit? unwatchable. yea and alright i friggin get it its easy to make gay jokes about Greek soldiers. no reason to waste millions of dollars and 2hrs of my life nailing that point down. Jesus how many lines do they want me to put down here. I suppose i can continue to bad mouth this steaming pile of garbage. When I first saw the original "Scary movie" previews i was afraid they were trying to belittle the movies they were spoofing. But after watching it I was relived that it was really funny. .Meet the spartans was everything i feared scarymovie was.

Review title: The worst movie I've ever seen.......it made me feel sad >:'(
Review_body: (**********this review contains spoilers*****************)This is officially the worst movie I've ever seen.....seriously retarded acting, lame predictable jokes and most of all, this movie just doesn't know when to stop! It instantly makes a joke about the Spartans being gay or whatever but, then instead of coming up with something original, repeat that joke over and over and over again. Next to that, you have your mediocre advertisement jokes where, the spartans drink Gatorade or Coca Cola or whatever. Another part that keeps coming back are look-a-likes and trust me...they're the worst you'll ever see on the big screen! >:( It comes down to the point that, most of the look-a-likes/randoms are kicked into the "deathpit". (Taken from the seen where Leonidas kicks Xerxes messenger into a pit.) This joke might make you smile a bit even though it was predictable but, again just like the Gay-jokes, it is used over and over again! After a while (about halfway through...) I actually started to feel embarrassed for watching this movie......YES it is that bad! Let me point something out here, there's nothing wrong with a bad movie, a B-action movie with flimsy special effects can be rather funny if watched with a couple of friends and a good amount of beverage :)This movie on the contrary is so distasteful, half-ass, downright stupid, that it makes you wish that you could get your money back... I've wasted 84 min of my live and 8 euros and I want 'em back JASON FRIEDBERG!I hope they somehow make a law that bans this guy from ever producing/directing a movie again! I hope this guy gets charged by NIKE for making a bad joke about their brand and so loses his career, his home and his liv....ah, I'm ranting x)Jason Friedberg, if you read this........give me my money back!rating -10000000/10 ....oh wait that's not possible :S (can't their be some sort exception made for this movie...please IMDb mods, we need your help!) ps. Damn you Friedberg, wasted another 5min. by writing this review!

Review title: I don't know what's left to say...
Review_body: I don't think i can do anything else but add to the bombardment of negative comments that this cheap excuse for a movie has already received from other users. I honestly thought they could have made something at least slightly watchable when lampooning 300 (Which is practically a parody in itself); instead, Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer have made what is clearly nothing more than a weak collection of jokes, purely for their own self-gain. Let's face it; if Friedberg and Seltzer were not doing this movie purely for monetary gain, they would most likely not keep resorting to YouTube humour and body gags. I was glad to see it had been knocked off the top-spot of the US charts by the Hannah Montana movie (Which scored 72% higher than this foul mess did)

Meet the Spartans is the worst movie I have ever seen! From the beginning to the end it was pure awful! I wish that it would disappear from the face of the earth. The jokes in it were boring, and it was very seldom that I or anybody else laughed in the theatre. (And it is supposed to be a comedy) I must say that I didn't expect much when I went to see it, but it was much worse than I ever thought it would be. All the time I just wished that it would end, and the creators of this crap can be happy about that it is the only movie that I've ever really wanted to walk out on.I do not recommend anyone to see it, not even my worst enemy.

First of all, I went to see this movie with a physically bad feeling. However, once in the confines of the movie, I forgot about my upset stomach. Knowing the kind of movie it was, and having seen 300 and various other movie references, I found "Meet the Spartans" to have given me what I came for; some good laughs, a chuckle here and there and kept up with the current themes of today. Next, the humor in it is a specific type - the ones that follow the "Date Movie", "Scary Movie", etc... so know that going in or else you might not have a pleasant experience.When the movie ended, I felt my stomach tighten up again. If nothing else, it entertained and took my mind off of my illness for a brief while. That's what a movie should do.

I can usually find something redeeming in almost any movie. I was anticipating something like Scary Movie, Joe Dirt, or any one of Will Farrel's flicks. You know, a movie so stupid it's funny. HOWEVER, this movie was so stupid it was just, well stupid, bordering on complete irritation. There were a number of kids in the theater and I can't say that I heard a single one laugh. A movie that is supposed to be funny and can't get a twelve year old to even giggle is pretty sad. I've never felt so compelled to walk from the theater before a film was over. It really is that bad. With so many great movies that go straight to DVD, I wonder how this one made it to the big screen.

This movie was such a tremendous waste of time. I actually fell asleep watching this crap. Most people wont mind watching a good spoof movie but this definitely was not a good one. It was an insult to the masterful work done with 300 as a matter of fact and the writers should be ashamed of themselves. Was this written by backup writers from kindergarten while the real writers were on strike or something? I recommend that you don't waste your time, money or effort watching this nonsense as my little sister could write a way better script than this heap of garbage and i do mean heap. The jokes were corny and childish and the movie was just supremely boring.

Review title: OMG - You call this a MOVIE?
Review_body: Holy Moly. I saw this for my birthday with a couple of mates, and we were seriously shocked. This movie is not even a movie. it is a bunch of HORRENDOUS jokes put together with pritt stick that would make a two year olds fingerprint painting look like the Mona Lisa. WHAT THE HELL IS THIS? I signed up for IMDb just to warn the poor people who are going to see this film. I am quite young and i usually love these kind of films, i loved date movie, but this is just going toooooo far. This film was rated 12A, meaning a kid younger that 12 could see this. We are talking about a film that has Carmen Electra wearing only a pizza slice and 2 tomatoes (and calling it a spa) , gay jokes that no one younger than 24 should see, music culture parodies (parodies? not even that!!!) that no one over 30 would understand, script quality that is a trillion times worse than a 5 year olds ''my day at the park'' essay. hell, that essay would be 3 times more funny and 10 times more interesting. Please, go bang your head with a hammer. it'll be much better for your brain cells.

It's a spoof of 300...in case you didn't know. Another run of the mill spoof movie that all these people are putting out lately. Yeah we can all admit that spoof movies are generally AWFUL...this one isn't an exception. I just hate that people take these moves so seriously. They try to often than not to point out mistakes and things like that. People like this (no offense) do not need to watch these sorts of movies. 'Meet the Spartans' has a couple of good chuckles, but it is a spoof...so don't expect much more than that.If you like a spoof movie then watch it....if you are expecting something else, don't waste your time.

Review title: Only a blank screen would've been worse.... Maybe.
Review_body: You know a movie will be bad when the funny parts of the commercial weren't even funny.Throughout this whole movie, I honestly think they used maybe three sets. I wondering if this was intentional, due to budget, or maybe on purpose (Though it's never mentioned in the movie).Now, this is billed as a 'comedy', which usually means humor. Maybe the writers didn't get that memo. This has as much humor as... An ER? Possibly. The only attempts at "humor" (and yes, it deserves to be quoted) in this movie are references. I can't imagine the "brainstorming" session the writers must've had: -"Okay, now they just talked to an enemy, what should we include to make this funny?" -"Let's put the American Idol judges in! They are from real life, so its funny!" (Though, judging from the script, they probably used smaller words) Now, I have no problem with advertising in movies, or in video games for that matter. It seems to make it more realistic. (I'd rather a character eat at a TGI Friday's instead of a Wednesday's). But it's just plain blatant advertising here. After a character is stranded in the Arctic (or, going back to poor set design, a floor with cotton and white confetti on it), he only survives by seeing a Subway sub on the ground. Humorous? No. Advertisement? Yes.Well, if you want about 80 wasted minutes of your life wasted, pick this up. If you enjoy good movies or at least some humor involved, just leave it.1/10 (Too bad stars can't go to negatives)

Review title: Two morons posing as directors produce a piece of crap
Review_body: These two idiots have turned a story about the heroic death of 300 men into one sick joke.....maybe they should look at their own heritage...there is a lot to make a crap movie about there. Do one of your crap pieces of work on schindlers list assholes...see how your people would take it...Aside from their obvious ignorance on historical facts..and insensitivity to other peoples culture...these two absolute morons...have made and continue to make absolute crap...with no storyline and no humour..These two idiots are so incompetent they are yet to write an original story themselves or produce anything of any substance..Any other paid emplyee would have been dismissed a long time ago for being as incompetent and useless.It says a lot about the state of the American film industry...that they sanction and produce this type of rubbish...shame on you idiots...get a real job..find something you can actually do..and stop subjecting the human race with your crap....As for the other morons who sanction this type of crap they should have a long hard look at themselves...Thank god I didn't pay to watch this crap..

I have to say I've seldom seen a movie that brought out so many comments at opposite ends of the spectrum. Every one I've read either enjoyed it completely or hated it intensely. I, for one, thought it was very entertaining and a great laugh. For me, a spoof is a movie that takes scenes from serious movies and throws in something that makes them truly ridiculous without distorting them to the point where they're unrecognizable. Meet the Spartans accomplishes that. Also, this movie parodies a particular movie(the 300) rather than poking fun at an entire genre like the Naked Gun series or the last three Scary Movies. To my mind it's a lot harder to find something funny about almost every part of a movie. In Meet the Spartans, every scene has a recognizable counterpart in the original movie(except maybe the Transformer)and each is spoofed to within an inch of it's life! As for those complaining about a never ending series of homosexual jokes, let's face it-the movie takes place in ancient Greece and even the original 300 refers to the Athenians as "boy lovers and philosophers". So what did you expect? I will grant that the naming of some characters is going too far. If there's anyone who hasn't seen American Idol enough to recognize the parody, they probably won't see this movie either. The only drawback to Meet the Spartans is that you have to see the 300 to truly appreciate what lengths the creators went to in order to make the scenes, characters and scenery itself match the original, and to really catch all the humor. I own both movies and I find that watching the parody makes me want to see the original again. Isn't that the mark of a true parody?

1. Worst 2. Awful 3. NauseatingThis movie has no excuse in the world. I wonder why Lionsgate even think of giving them the money to do what secondary school children can do better. A school stage play I once saw was even better than this, even when the backdrop fell over their heads and half of them cried. The jokes are so stale. One can tell a joke once or twice and it still can be funny but after the 7th time it gets annoying. Maybe the reason why this movie dwells so much on one gag (albeit not a funny one, e.g. the dance-off, the deathly kick to the pits - all 53 of them, the game show references etc...) is because the set was so elaborately and painstakingly built, (and the dancers were so highly paid) they were trying so hard to milk every single lame gag they could think of and make full use (or abuse) of it. This movie has no particular direction, other than the one from the original movie, and definitely requires no talent whatsoever to make and I won't be surprised Friedberg and Seltzer would re-spoof this movie again given the chance. (It's probably in post-production...).

Review title: Ugliest movie i have ever seen!
Review_body: Ugliest movie i have ever seen. Waste of time,if i was a producer of 300,i would open a case about this garbage movie.59 minutes...is there a movie with 59 minutes...Ohh my god,the money you spent for this awful money,you should spend that for poor people...Please don't watch this movie...You will hate movies after that garbage! And Carmen Electra,the most desirable woman on earth.Why you played in this movie?Why? You can lost a lot of fans after that. İ really cant imagine,which brain can make this kind of movie. Hollywood,in my opinion,lost a lot of blood after making this kind of movies:Disaster movie(Really a disaster),Meet the spartans,Superhero movie...why you make this kind of movies,you cant see the truth,we hate that!

Review title: A well made and clever Parody
Review_body: OK, first, I'm one of those that prefer watching Shawshank Redemption over Scary movie anytime.Lately, I don't really like the shallowness and in-your-face-nature of parodies. I guess I was spoiled since I was one of those that had a chance to watch and enjoy "Top Secret!" 24 years ago. (yes, time flies by fast!) Gotta say though that this one stroke a note. It took the "politically correct" normally seen in movies from tinsel town and threw it away in the trash, which makes it such a great movie. That means that you won't really have to pretend you're enjoying this movie because you are the one that chose to rent it at the video store, but rather really enjoy it...I can see the people liking Amer1can Id0l or Br1tney Spear5 not liking this movie though...Should I say more? Enjoy!

One word to describe this film is garbage, another one is awful, then there's terrible and so on and so on.The film is just one very bad attempt at comedy after another and then again and again and so to the very bitter end. That seems to be the full content of the movie just poor jokes all the way through. The first Scary Movie film was actually quite good but they have went downhill dramatically since and this is just the worst of them all.A question that needs asking is why does everything have to be so funny, why not have some more actual film content - I mean I don't mind spoof movies, 'Just Another Teen Movie' was great, Scary Movie 1 was good but this is genuinely garbage. One good thing is Carmen Electra - she does add a little glamour to the movie, but it's just so full of very very poor 'funny bits' that it's just not funny.

Review title: Even worse than it's rumored to be
Review_body: This hideous excuse for a movie doesn't even deserve a score of 1 out of 300, let alone 1 out of 10. However, sadly, there is no way for me to hand out a score lower than that.After sitting through almost one and a half hour of this worthless garbage, I hand out the first 1 I've ever given a movie in my entire life, and I still feel like I'm being too generous.Every scene of 'Meet the Spartans' is extremely predictable to most human beings capable of extending their mental abilities beyond that of a seagull, since they all involve some kind of punchline thrown in at the exact moment where you would expect it. Even if you're into the kind of sad humor this movie features, 'Meet the Spartans' will fail to surprise you a single time, and thus, fall flat.A major ingredient of 'Meet the Spartan'-humor is the idea that anything can be funny if you add a famous name, however, just trying to be funny by randomly insulting celebrities is a very cheap way to produce laughter. People will laugh when they recognize the celebrity-look-alike on screen without thinking.I'm not trying to insult the people who made 'Meet the Spartans'. It is my belief that they just didn't care about quality when they made this movie.As a side note, after seeing 'Meet the Spartans', a friend of mine just raised the score of every Uwe Boll move he's ever seen.

Review title: Are all the people posting comments that old?
Review_body: I've been viewing through the comments and all of them rated the movie 1 star or maximally 2. From what point of view, my question is, did you rate it.This movie was a hilarious movie and perhaps the funniest I've ever seen. I know you guys love 300 and perhaps took it as a mock but... it is a good movie. Reading the comments, I realized or thought that people posting are old... I think you guys didn't really get it but for a 14 year old kid, it was f***ing hilarious.

It is a great movie if you are not American. How can you explain that comedies like Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy has a user rating of 7 or Blades of glory has 6.6? Meet the Spartans has many funny scenes and dialogs. The characters are well developed and there was never a dull moment, the script flowed easily, the acting was first-rate. Parody movies are always of the type 'love or hate' it. I don't see why so many people hate this movie. I am not intellectual, I love cinema as culture, but also as entertainment, so I like them. Congratulations on a movie that not only met expectations but exceeded them.

Who rates these things? Seriously. I watched the first 5-10 minutes and it is way obvious to me that I would not allow my 13 year old to see this movie. There are references to sex acts and profanity in every single scene! This is not comedic genius, it is idiotic obscenity. It isn't even funny. It is in extremely poor taste and shows no artistry whatsoever. Shame on the writers, actors, producers, and especially the poor judgment of whatever stupid agency rated this pg-13. So, not only is it definitely not appropriate for young teenagers, it isn't even worth watching for those that are not as concerned over censorship issues. It is just really terrible. I cannot think of anything I have seen recently that would compete well as the worst piece of "film" I have ever seen.

Review title: Don't watch this if you have taste or a sense of humour
Review_body: That was one of the worst films i have ever had the misfortune to have seen, the jokes were weak and pointless, they have tried to sound like there cool and modern by including things like the fat guy from Borat, but they fail.Most of it does not even make any sense, they have to describe their jokes to the audience and i would bet you that even the most stupid, mental ill person would see that this film is a waste of time and effort.In fact this film annoyed me so much that i felt like trowing the TV out of the window to end the pain, it was that irritating. And remember the tasteless idiots responsible for this travesty are also responsible for Disaster movie, date movie and scary movie. I can not understand why these people are allowed to continually make these films.The acting isn't much better, there is not one person in this fill who i wouldn't give a razzy to, they were appalling. Not even one of the actors in it were remotely gifted, of course it was not helped that none of their characters had an one bit of charisma or charm. It is an ugly attempt to just use a series of you tube clips, act them out and call them characters.The only way i didn't give it a 1 is because: 1-The begging was not too bad, it even made me smile, but when they got onto the stupid gay jokes it was the begging of the end. 2-1 Is reserved for the very worst of the worst and only Superbabies 2 gets that.This infantile piece of crap should never have been made, it is immature, vulgar and not even funny. 300 is not a good film and deserves a spoof but this just makes a average film look good. Don't watch this i beg you its not worth the pain and suffering you will experience from it limp and totally unfunny script.

Review title: Not funny now not funny 10 years from now.....
Review_body: I have absolutely NO IDEA how this movie could have been green lit by any sane person. This movie and others like it(Date movie, Epic movie)are targeted at a "main stream" audience, by this I mean 9th graders, pot-heads,Reality TV viewers,meth addicts and people who use the word "like"like every other like word.... As long as THEY keep watching, this rubbish will continue to be put in the theaters.....But with this,these movies will be forgotten just as quickly. 10 years from now,do you think ANYONE will remember this crap? I think not. Naked gun,Hot shots,Top secret,Anything by Mel Brooks, will always be classics, and will ALWAYS be funny..............this BullCrap is not funny now,and will not be funny ever. .....LOL 2.5 out of 10 Stars says it all....I've seen funnier stuff on You-tube.....

Review title: If I could give it zero then I would
Review_body: Awful "film". Terrible story, terrible script, not even remotely funny or original

Review title: one of the best movies I ever seen
Review_body: I know that everybody say that this movie is stupid and unfunny,but It's a parody!If you don't catch that this movie is a parody!It look stupid,but that's sarcasm,you have to be stupid to don't catch that!And I think that for every Aron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg movie! If you think that this movie is totally unfunny,you must laugh even in a moment,there's no that junk movie.And what about jokes that are not subtitled for children,a lot of movies have that.It's a great movie,not like "Godfather",but it's very cool movie,we cannot say that some movies are junk just because their not like "Godfather". Don't be so stupid.Think about it.

Review title: I'm feeling generous so it gets a 2/10.
Review_body: The first thing I have to say about this film is that it is easily one of the most appalling films I have ever watched. It frankly disgusts me that these people were given millions of dollars to produce such utter shite. I laughed once throughout the entire film at a line delivered in approximately the first 2 minutes, the rest was embarrassing and insulting to watch. I can justify watching an awful film if I can laugh at it, such as 'House of the Dead', which despite being a train wreck of a film was actually unintentionally quite funny. However, Meet the Spartans despite aiming to be funny was frankly excruciating to watch. All I could think of throughout was that I was slowly losing an hour of my life and £5.50 that I would never see again.The jokes are immature and at times homophobic. The humour is basically trash that I'm almost certain could and would have only appealed to a group of 15 year old boys. Upon leaving the cinema I have never seen such a depressed group of people. The movie is from the same writers as 'Date Movie', 'Epic Movie' and the Scary Movie films. I personally am quite a fan of the Scary Movie films and thought I would give this the benefit of the doubt despite being very disappointed with 'Date Movie'. I have however learnt my lesson now and shall be investing no more money into watching any of Jason Friedberg or Aaron Seltzers films.The cast is not particularly promising but neither did I expect it to be a death sentence. Sean Maguire and Carmen Electra both star in the main roles, but I personally don't think the casting had anything to do with the fall down of this film, nothing could have saved this. The script is frankly appalling, the story is messy and the humour is just offensive; sadly not in a tongue in cheek way. I think that Mr. Friedberg and Mr. Seltzer need to learn the use of subtly. Sometimes less really is more. It seemed with this film everything including the jokes had to be taken to the extreme. Their exhausting efforts to be funny are actually the only funny thing about this film.

See this. There are no jokes. The writers are 13 year old boys. The okes revolve around seeing movies and the puch lines from the movies you've already seen. Plus Kevin Sorbo!. Do not support the idiots who write this shite. There is no comedy in this movie. A Mike myers movie is funnier. I can't believe someone wanted to put money into this.See this. There are no jokes. The writers are 13 year old boys. The okes revolve around seeing movies and the puch lines from the movies you've already seen. Plus Kevin Sorbo!. Do not support the idiots who write this shite. There is no comedy in this movie. A Mike myers movie is funnier. I can't believe someone wanted to put money into this.

None of the jokes were expected, a whole new kind of comedy that's way ahead of its time. If you haven't seen this movie, you haven't lived!!! Personally, I enjoyed the film, the structure of the gags were quite amusing, and the pop culture references delivered to the viewer were executed perfectly. I got quite a good laugh out of the movie, but some parts did disappoint me for I haven't become familiar towards half of the comedic spin-offs presented. Too many of the reviews on this website degrade it for little to no reason, all they say is "IT'S A HORRIBLE MOVIE, DON'T WATCH IT LOL", except in a longer context.In my opinion, the movie was great, the story actually had meaning except in a satirical view. If you're gonna buy the movie, I suggest the Uncut Version, the extra content is absolutely wonderful and will give you more reason to watch the whole thing.

Meet The Spartans not only proves that you can still go lower from Epic Movie, it also makes you wonder who is to blame. Someone paid to see this film, despite having seen the advertisements. Someone believed spending money in a collection of awful jokes and what might have been called pop culture references if they had any depth was the right thing to do. If you walked up to a random child and asked him/her to write a short summary for an original movie script, you'd get better results than Meet The Spartans.It is just that bad. Do everyone a favor, do not support the makers of this movie. Do not see it, buy it or rent it. Forget it even exists.Meet The Spartans is a new low for the American film industry.

Carmen Electra is a whore just like she is in all her movies this movie was so terrible that we had to sneak into 2 other movies to make up for the money that we wasted on that one. every single funny scene is on the previews ..not only that...half the movie is in the previews it was only an hour and a half there was no point to it at all. its just a cheap repeat of every single movie they have made like this. only they are really losing their touch.The humor is awful and instead of laughing it mostly made me sick. If I could contain my disgust and sum this movie up with one word it would simply be...Crap But don't let my words discourage you go see for yourself. or don't waste your time and money and go see a better movie

Overwhelmingly sexist. Not just to women but also men. Closely followed by a whole horde of homophobia and racism. If you find it funny you're an awful human being. The references to other pop culture is okay, but could be better. Better if it wasn't so offensive. Be prepared for bad paint and photo shop, bad lines about stereotypical homosexuals and stereotypical female roles. If there's irony in it I failed to see it. The sexism and racism combine in a completely inappropriate comment about Muslim women's attire, and Carmen's character does not help the situation. Offensive on every front. 0/10 for me!

This is one of those movies that will make the top 10 worst comedies of all time list. The humor, if you can even call that, will be found funny by pre-pubescent boys and girl at best. I fell asleep during the second half of the movie, because I could not take watching it anymore and my friend (who was driving) was still watching. NOTHING in this movie was funny, not even one part. However, you will see 3 blatant commercials during the movie, literally. This is the type of the movie that will show 3 funny things in the commercial and those will be THE ONLY funny parts in the WHOLE movie, but I didn't even find those funny, because in the real movie they are NOT.Please, don't waste your time.

This movie seriously depressed me. Epic movie gave me a few laughs, dismal as it was, Date Movie made me giggle a bit, && even The Scary Movies were something of a riot. But this...this one was terrible, even for the series' standards.The Stomp the Yard spoof was entirely too long. It was only funny for about the first ten seconds. After that it was awkward, because you knew you were suppose to be laughing, but it just wasn't funny.The pit of death was the only truly funny bit, for me. But the constant reference to popular TV reality shows quickly became tiresome. They weren't original or funny.This movie wasn't good at all, not by any standards. I went to this movie hoping to be laughing the whole time, but instead I was wishing I had better invested my $7.

So I just got back and from seeing Meet the Spartans and I have to say that it is possibly the greatest movie that I have ever seen. I mean, I thought 300 was just an awful movie and the action was just plain boring.Meet the Spartans had some of the best action sequences ever. And Kevin Sorbo, come on, possible one of the best supporting actors of the year. He definitely better not get snubbed at the Oscars.Pros: 1. Kevin Sorbo 2. excellent "yo mama" battles that were even too great for 8 mile. 3. The fat kid with no eyes 4. Xerxes, played by "the Borat guy" 5. Paris Hilton jokes (I never get tired of hearing about her) 6. The excessive gay references 7. and of course, Kevin Sorbo.Cons: 1. It just wasn't long enough. There was so much humor packed into one short film.I suggest that everyoone see this movie, especially if you have some kind of mental disorder12/10!

Review title: Stupid beyond belief but not painful
Review_body: I watched this movie as I marathoned the IMDb bottom 100, so I now how much movies can hurt. this movie does not hurt me. It has no self contained plot, and after five minutes of euphoric high caused by an almost its so bad its good, my brain adjusted to the randomness of the film I just watched it and attempted to guess the jokes before they happened for the remaining 55 minutes. My opinion on it is that it was a complete and utter waste of time, and the only reason it gets one star instead of three is that I PAID FIVE DANG DOLLARS FOR IT. I could go onto Youtube watch a summary of 300, the movie this is ripping off, then a video of a grown man crapping his pants in public, and finish it off by starring at a wall for an hour and get the same experience. They didn't even let me rent it on amazon, they made me buy it so that when I am watching a movie with friends I will have to explain why MEET THE SPARTANS is in my movie library. As a side note I watched this with two other people who both claim it was the worst movie they have ever seen and was so painful to watch one of them dropped out of the marathon. My theory is that this movie did not hurt me because I am a cynical nihilist who is not surprised that such horrors could be put to celluloid. So in conclusion I would not suggest this movie to anyone and if it doesn't cause you unimaginable pain it will leave a nauseous feeling because you will have to live the wrest of your life knowing you gave money to these soulless hacks.

Review title: Absolutely unfunny in every way ever.
Review_body: In the most unoriginal movie of the decade, a sparse, vague plot involving 13 Spartans battling a Persian army at Thermopylae, which (is it funny already?) consists mainly of the most clumsy, inept pop culture references of anything popular since December 2006.From the moment we see Shrek as one of the Spartan babies being inspected, it is more than obvious that whatever money anyone spent on this film was a complete waste and should be refunded with an apology.Yes, it is that bad. I only found myself seeing it because I attended a movie marathon and this happened to be included in this discounted ticket price. And it was still a rip-off.This film is a shame to the already severely failing genre of spoof. It is not clever in any way, and the only decent writing in any part of the film are lines directly taken from 300. I hypothesise that these films- Meet the Spartans, Epic Movie and Date Movie- follow the world's most mind-numbing formula;1. Take movies that have been relatively decent or popular, that people have thought about spoofing and have done so correctly on some occasions, and therefore YOU should not touch, because YOU will fail epically. 2. Strip the plot/s down to the barest, often irrelevant aspects, leaving plenty of room (hopefully at least, in the case of Meet the Spartans, 55 minutes for inane references to everything unfunny ever)for material that is not related to the plot in any way.3. Make a list of every film that has been relatively popular for the last few years, and make a list of everything that is irrelevant to the plot of the spoof, but is popular to the film, and find ways to pop it in the spoof with the subtlety and skill of a 3 year old painting with a cat. You MUST mention EXACTLY where the parody is coming from. An obviously offhand comment "You've got HAPPY FEET" or a casual complete zoom in to Rocky's iconic boxing shorts, reading "ROCKY" should do the trick nicely. 4. Make a list of obviously very funny things such as people repeatedly getting hurt (Yeah, repeated child abuse in Meet The Spartans is ever-so-funny) and be sure to drag it out AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. Use this philosophy with every unfunny gag in the film. AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE. I'm talking at least 10 minutes of the same thing here. 5. Release as a film. It doesn't have to be funny in any way for it to make money. Surely the world has gone downhill and died, its rotting remains appearing to be the very stuff this film is made of. Almost everything in the whole film that is parodied (and I use that term with as little discretion as possible) can be seen in the trailers, and even with the limited time in a trailer, it still sucks.I think I need a drink.

Review title: Boycott this movie, for the good of the world
Review_body: I refused to see this movie for obvious reasons. To be fair, I rated it based on the trailer (a generous 1, give is zero IMDb!!) I didn't need to see any more than that. If you think that's narrow minded of me, well maybe you could fill me in on what happens?I also voted it 1 in the hope that it might help stop such films being made. As Mark Kermode said this week "If you pay to go and see that kind of movie, it's your fault when they do it next time. It's a personal responsibility issue, there is no excuse." Perhaps some will say "No one's forcing you to see it, it's just a bit of fun." Well that's bull. There are thousands of incredible screenplays and supremely talented filmmakers out there, and only a finite amount of film capital to be had. Think of the dozen or so beautiful indie movies that could have been made with the budget used for this.This kind of dross is cynical, depressing, bandwagon jumping studio zombie fodder. And judging by the trailers, about as funny as a cot death.

Review title: HORRIBLE! I agree with this review
Review_body: I saw this review and could not possibly agree with these guys more. F THESE GUYS! F THIS MOVIE!!!! UGh, what a waste of film, time and space. When will the studios learn??? Seriously, i've never had such a visceral reaction to any movie before. I thought things like Epic Movie were bad. That makes THIS look like The Godfather. And the worst, most hateful part about this is that it was NUMBER ONE at the box office this weekend. NUMBER ONE?! It's about time that people stop going to see the filth that Hollywood is putting out. It's getting to the point where it's not even worth leaving the house for 2 hours for this sh*t, let alone lay down your heard earned money for it. If you get 2 minutes, check this out. It's funnier than that POS moviehttp://www.spill.com/movie-review/Meet+the+Spartans/422457

I actually watched this movie thinking that most people here on IMDb were just jumping on the 'this movie sucks' bandwagon and that it couldn't be as bad as people claimed it was.There is absolutely NO comedy in this movie whatsoever.. it's just pure and pure nonsense that could only make 3-year olds laugh. Scenes are stretched out FAR too long and that would be OK if they were fun or interesting but it's just boredom.I do not remember myself laughing once during this movie. I could not even manage to get off an innocent smile. It's just horrible.I'd say the only good thing about this movie would be Carmen Electra but since there are 'interesting' pics of her all over the internet that's a minus as well.DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE!

too horrible to think about this auditory and visual disaster.if you consider watching this; here is a list of things I recommend instead:1. invite some friends and have a glass of good wine 2. jump of a cliffand all things in between, which means; all the good and bad things you can do in life are way better than watching this piece of crap.the humor was not funny but offensive, the movie that was used as framework is too good to use for a spoof, carmen electra is getting way to old for these "roles" and the only pretty girl in the movie was made to look like lindsay lohan... WHY???for the producers: do yourself and us a favour, quit the movie business

The only satisfaction you will get from this flick is if you pick this movie up and give it to the person you hate most. That way you can feel as if you murdered apart of them when they watch it.If for some morbid reason you still feel the need to watch this or are just mildly retarded.I would go with the ladder and just stab yourself in the face a few dozen times. Not only will it be more entertaining you will be less bored.In fact your friends will find it more comical than this film.If you are Hardcore and wish to test your willpower and endurance this is the perfect movie. I will advise however it will shave 5 yrs off your life. Do you know how it feels to be loved? If so watch this and you will know how it feels to be worthless. Do you know what it feels like to be worthless? Well watch this and you will probably off yourself.

What were they thinking?
This atrocity fails on every level...and I don't feel so good about penguins any more either.

Review title: Worst movie i've seen in a theater
Review_body: I was recently forced to sit through Meet the Spartans. Ill start by saying that i'm very sick of all this epic/date/scary movie junk. It's been overdone and only appeals to people under the age of 9. The humor in this movie was just as awful as i thought it would be and i could predict the entire movie. I was told before-hand that it was only about 90 minutes, and was a little upset id be paying for that. After watching the movie i was beyond glad that i only had to be tortured for that long, rather than the usual 2 hours. I'll close by saying that if you're forced to watch this movie, rip your eyes out of your skull and pour salt into your head. It will be much more enjoyable.
